original: 'di la spyi smra ba rnams rgol bar byed de /
analyzed: 'di la spyi smra ba rnams rgol bar byed de /
translated: In response to this, the proponents of the theory of universals argue as follows:

original: gal te shing ni shing ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te shing ni shing ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If a tree is different from non-trees,

original: de ni brda'i dus su shing min 'dzin pa med par de ltar gzung bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir dang / shing mi shes pa can gyis de rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo shing min yang yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni brda'i dus su shing min 'dzin pa med par de ltar gzung bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir dang / shing mi shes pa can gyis de rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo shing min yang yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it cannot be apprehended in that way without apprehending non-trees at the time of the convention, because one who does not know a tree would not know the nature of the exclusion of non-tree, even though it is completely unknown.

original: shing min ci zhig ces dris pa na smras pa gang shing ma yin pa'o zhes dang / shing ci zhig gang shing min ma yin pa'o zhes phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: shing min ci zhig ces dris pa na smras pa gang shing ma yin pa'o zhes dang / shing ci zhig gang shing min ma yin pa'o zhes phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa ste /
translated: When asked, ‚ÄúWhat is a non-tree?‚Äù one says, ‚ÄúIt is what is not a tree,‚Äù and when asked, ‚ÄúWhat is a tree?‚Äù one says, ‚ÄúIt is what is not a non-tree.‚Äù This is the fault of mutual dependence.

original: 'di'i phyir blo la mi gnas pa'i don la gzhan rnam par gcod pas brda bya bar mi nus so zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir blo la mi gnas pa'i don la gzhan rnam par gcod pas brda bya bar mi nus so zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to make a convention by excluding other objects that do not exist in the mind.

original: de rnams kyi spyi la brda byed pa na yang shing min rnam par bcad dam 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: de rnams kyi spyi la brda byed pa na yang shing min rnam par bcad dam 'on te ma yin /
translated: Even when making a convention about a universal, is a non-tree excluded or not?

original: gal te rnam gcod na sngar shing //
analyzed: gal te rnam gcod na sngar shing //
translated: If it is excluded, then it is as before.

original: 'dzin pa med na ci ltar shes //
analyzed: 'dzin pa med na ci ltar shes //
translated: If there is no apprehension, how can there be cognition?

original: de'i tshe rtogs pa pos shing shes pa ma yin pas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rtogs pa pos shing shes pa ma yin pas te /
translated: At that time, the cognizer is not a tree, nor is he a cognition.

original: shing dang shing min shes pa kho na'i ched du /
analyzed: shing dang shing min shes pa kho na'i ched du /
translated: For the sake of the cognition of tree and non-tree,

original: de don du gnyer ba nyid du nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de don du gnyer ba nyid du nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: he approaches with the desire for that.

original: mi shes pa des ci ltar brda la shing min rnam par gcod pa rtogs @254b par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi shes pa des ci ltar brda la shing min rnam par gcod pa rtogs @254b par 'gyur /
translated: How can he understand the exclusion of non-tree through conventional symbols, by that non-cognition?

original: mi rtogs na yang gzhan rnam par ma bcad pas bkod pa'i sgra las /
analyzed: mi rtogs na yang gzhan rnam par ma bcad pas bkod pa'i sgra las /
translated: Even if he does not understand, due to the non-exclusion of others, from the word tree,

original: de yongs su spangs nas tha snyad la 'jug pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yongs su spangs nas tha snyad la 'jug pa mi rigs te /
translated: it is not reasonable to engage in convention by completely abandoning that.

original: shing sha ba la sogs pa'i khyad par bzhin no //
analyzed: shing sha ba la sogs pa'i khyad par bzhin no //
translated: Like the distinctions of ≈õim≈õapƒÅ and so on.

original: gang rnam par ma bcad pas gang la brdar byas pa'i sgra ni de la de yongs su spangs pas 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang rnam par ma bcad pas gang la brdar byas pa'i sgra ni de la de yongs su spangs pas 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The word that is not excluded by what is excluded does not engage in that by completely abandoning that.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: shing nyid la shing sha pa la sogs pa khyad par rnam par ma bcad par brdar byas pa'i shing gi sgra ni de yongs su spangs pas 'jug pa ma yin pa bzhin /
analyzed: shing nyid la shing sha pa la sogs pa khyad par rnam par ma bcad par brdar byas pa'i shing gi sgra ni de yongs su spangs pas 'jug pa ma yin pa bzhin /
translated: The word tree is applied to a tree by convention without distinguishing it from other trees such as ≈õim≈õapƒÅ trees and so on.

original: shing gi sgra yang shing nyid la shing min rnam par ma bcad pas brdar byas pa'o //
analyzed: shing gi sgra yang shing nyid la shing min rnam par ma bcad pas brdar byas pa'o //
translated: The word tree is applied to a tree by convention without distinguishing it from non-trees.

original: 'gal bas khyab pa'o //üîΩde ltar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: 'gal bas khyab pa'o // de ltar 'gyur mod /
translated: The pervasion is by contradiction.

original: spyi dngos por smra ba ni /
analyzed: spyi dngos por smra ba ni /
translated: That may be so, but the proponents of real universals say,

original: 'ga' zhig rnam par bcad pas cung zad sgrub pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rnam par bcad pas cung zad sgrub pa ma yin gyi /
translated: the exclusion of some does not establish anything at all.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po gcig cig yang dag par bstan nas /
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po gcig cig yang dag par bstan nas /
translated: Having correctly indicated a single thing that is present in front of one,üîΩone applies the convention ‚ÄúThis is a tree.‚Äù In that way, at the time of the convention, only the universal or that which is related to it that is seen is understood at the time of the term.

original: 'di shing yin zhes brdar byed la de ltar brda'i dus su mthong ba kho na'i spyi'am de dang 'brel pa can ni tha snyad kyi dus su yang rtogs so zhes pas thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di shing yin zhes brdar byed la de ltar brda'i dus su mthong ba kho na'i spyi'am de dang 'brel pa can ni tha snyad kyi dus su yang rtogs so zhes pas thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore the reductio is not similar.

original: mi mtshungs pa ma yin te gang gi phyir gcig rab tu bstan nas 'di shing ngo zhes smra ba yang /üîΩnges par bzung nas brda byed dam /
analyzed: mi mtshungs pa ma yin te gang gi phyir gcig rab tu bstan nas 'di shing ngo zhes smra ba yang / nges par bzung nas brda byed dam /
translated: It is not similar because one is indicated and it is said, ‚ÄúThis is a tree.‚ÄùüîΩIs a convention made through ascertainment?

original: 'o na te nges par ma bzung ba yin /
analyzed: 'o na te nges par ma bzung ba yin /
translated: Or is it not ascertained?

original: gal te 'di kho na shing yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes nges par bzung nas yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di kho na shing yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes nges par bzung nas yin na /
translated: If it is ascertained, ‚ÄúThis alone is a tree, not another,‚Äù

original: sngar shing 'dzin pa med pas shing min yongs su mi shes pa ni ci ltar brda la de yongs su bcad pa rtogs par byed /
analyzed: sngar shing 'dzin pa med pas shing min yongs su mi shes pa ni ci ltar brda la de yongs su bcad pa rtogs par byed /
translated: since there is no prior apprehension of a tree, how could one understand the exclusion of non-tree through that convention?

original: ci ste 'di yang shing ste gzhan yang yin no zhes nges par ma bzung ba yin na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di yang shing ste gzhan yang yin no zhes nges par ma bzung ba yin na /
translated: But if it is not ascertained, ‚ÄúThis is a tree, and so is another,‚Äù

original: ci ltar rtogs pa po tha snyad kyi tshe gzhan yongs su spangs pas 'jug ces pa skyon de kho na'o //
analyzed: ci ltar rtogs pa po tha snyad kyi tshe gzhan yongs su spangs pas 'jug ces pa skyon de kho na'o //
translated: how could the one who understands engage in convention by excluding another? That is the only fault.

original: ci ste mthong ba las bzlog pa ni shes par sla ba'i phyir skyon med de /
analyzed: ci ste mthong ba las bzlog pa ni shes par sla ba'i phyir skyon med de /
translated: But if it is said, ‚ÄúThere is no fault because it is easy to understand the opposite of seeing,‚Äù

original: gcig 'ga' zhig mthong ba dang ldan zhing gzhan la de dang mi mthun pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo nyams su myong ba la ni brda'i dus na gzung ba'i dngos po de las /
analyzed: gcig 'ga' zhig mthong ba dang ldan zhing gzhan la de dang mi mthun pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo nyams su myong ba la ni brda'i dus na gzung ba'i dngos po de las /
translated: Some see one thing and experience a cognition that has a different aspect with regard to another.üîΩ

original: de las bzlog pa'i rnam pa can 'di ni gzhan no zhes chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i rnam pa can 'di ni gzhan no zhes chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: But when one sees one tree and experiences a cognition having an aspect that is incompatible with that tree, then at the time of the convention, one ascertains the difference of the tree, thinking, ‚ÄúThis one is different from that one.‚Äù

original: des ni 'di kho na shing ngo zhes rab tu rtogs par byas te /üîΩgang kho na la de mi snang ba de kho na shing ma yin par @255a * //
analyzed: des ni 'di kho na shing ngo zhes rab tu rtogs par byas te / gang kho na la de mi snang ba de kho na shing ma yin par @255a * //
translated: Thus, one understands, ‚ÄúThis one is a tree.‚Äù

original: rang nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And one understands by oneself, ‚ÄúThat one is not a tree.‚Äù

original: rnam par gcod pa smra ba la 'di mi srid de /
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa smra ba la 'di mi srid de /
translated: This is not possible for the proponents of exclusion,

original: gcig tu mthong ba'i ngo bo ni 'ga' zhig la yang rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu mthong ba'i ngo bo ni 'ga' zhig la yang rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature that is seen in one thing does not occur in any other thing.

original: mngon sum gyi brda'i dus bzung ba ni phyis mi rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi brda'i dus bzung ba ni phyis mi rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: And the object that is grasped at the time of the convention of perception is not understood later.

original: rtogs pa yod na yang brda'i dus su gzung ba'i shing gi gsal ba ni gsal ba gzhan la yang de kho na 'di'o zhes rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtogs pa yod na yang brda'i dus su gzung ba'i shing gi gsal ba ni gsal ba gzhan la yang de kho na 'di'o zhes rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one understands the tree that is apprehended at the time of the sign, one would not understand that the tree that is apprehended at the time of the signified is that very tree.

original: de ltar ni ji ltar bu ma pa de las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa de ltar pa la sha la sogs pa'i khyad par yang ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni ji ltar bu ma pa de las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa de ltar pa la sha la sogs pa'i khyad par yang ste /
translated: Just as the son of a barren woman is not similar to a cow, so too the tree is not similar to the tree that is apprehended at the time of the signified.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the nature of the tree that is apprehended at the time of the signified does not exist.

original: de ltar na 'o na 'di na sel ba smra ba la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na 'di na sel ba smra ba la yang mtshungs te /
translated: If that is so, then it is similar in the case of the proponent of exclusion.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po 'di rnams tha dad kyang 'ga' zhig rnams ni ngo shes la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig rang bzhin gyis byed kyi gzhan rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po 'di rnams tha dad kyang 'ga' zhig rnams ni ngo shes la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig rang bzhin gyis byed kyi gzhan rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: Because although these things are different, some things are the cause of a single effect, such as recognition, but others are not.

original: de rnams mthong nas rtogs pa bos 'di rnams ni de'i rgyu ste gzhan rnams ni ma yin no zhes blos rnam par phye nas phung po gnyis su rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: de rnams mthong nas rtogs pa bos 'di rnams ni de'i rgyu ste gzhan rnams ni ma yin no zhes blos rnam par phye nas phung po gnyis su rnam par 'jog go //
translated: Having seen them, one understands that these are the cause of that and those are not, and having distinguished them with the mind, one posits them as two classes.

original: de la 'di ni brgyud pas 'bras bu gcig ba can gyi dngos po las skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'di ni brgyud pas 'bras bu gcig ba can gyi dngos po las skye ba'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, the object of the cognition of a universal is a thing that is the cause of a single effect, because it arises from a thing that is the cause of a single effect.

original: tha mi dad pa'i don 'dzin pa can yang ste /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i don 'dzin pa can yang ste /
translated: It is also the object of a cognition that apprehends a nondistinct object.

original: de nyams su myong ba las skye ba'i rang bzhin las phyi rol gyi don du lhag par zhen pa'i ngo bo can spyi'i rnam pa dang ldan pa ngo shes pa la /
analyzed: de nyams su myong ba las skye ba'i rang bzhin las phyi rol gyi don du lhag par zhen pa'i ngo bo can spyi'i rnam pa dang ldan pa ngo shes pa la /
translated: The cognition of a universal is a cognition that arises from the experience of a thing that is the cause of a single effect. It has the nature of the conception of an external object. It has the aspect of a universal.

original: gang 'bras bu gcig pa'i rgyu nyid kyis rnam par phye ba rnams phyi rol bzhin dang don bya ba byed bzhin dang / rjes su 'gro ba can gyi ngo bo 'ga' zhig gi rjes su song ba bzhin du so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: gang 'bras bu gcig pa'i rgyu nyid kyis rnam par phye ba rnams phyi rol bzhin dang don bya ba byed bzhin dang / rjes su 'gro ba can gyi ngo bo 'ga' zhig gi rjes su song ba bzhin du so sor snang ngo //
translated: The things that are distinguished by being the cause of a single effect appear individually, as if they were external objects, as if they were performing a function, and as if they were the substrata of universals.

original: phyi rol gyi don gyi rang bzhin du zhen par byas pa de rnams rtogs nas /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyi rang bzhin du zhen par byas pa de rnams rtogs nas /
translated: Having conceived of the nature of external objects,

original: rtogs pa po'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la tha mi dad par rab tu snang ba rnams rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis mthong ba bzhin du rang rang gi snang ba nyams su myong na yang gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtogs pa po'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la tha mi dad par rab tu snang ba rnams rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis mthong ba bzhin du rang rang gi snang ba nyams su myong na yang gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i phyir /
translated: The conceptual thoughts of the cognizer appear undifferentiably to them, just as a person with cataracts sees two moons. Although they experience their own appearances, they conceive of them as one.

original: de rnams bstan nas 'di rnams shing ngo zhes brda byas pa na /
analyzed: de rnams bstan nas 'di rnams shing ngo zhes brda byas pa na /
translated: When the word ‚Äútree‚Äù is applied to those [appearances],

original: 'khrul pa des de la rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo gcig bzhin du mthong nas /
analyzed: 'khrul pa des de la rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo gcig bzhin du mthong nas /
translated: that error follows them. Seeing them as one entity,

original: de'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid du rnam par phye ba de las bzlog pa'i rnam pa can rnams la shing min nyid du bde blag tu lhag par zhen par byed do //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid du rnam par phye ba de las bzlog pa'i rnam pa can rnams la shing min nyid du bde blag tu lhag par zhen par byed do //
translated: they easily conceive of those that have a different aspect as not being a tree, as being excluded from that.

original: de la tha dad pa mthong yang gang zhig mthong ba dang ma mthong bdag gis 'di shing dang shing min pa rnam par 'byed par byed pa dngos po tha mi dad pa ba ltar rung ba @255b gcig ni med de /
analyzed: de la tha dad pa mthong yang gang zhig mthong ba dang ma mthong bdag gis 'di shing dang shing min pa rnam par 'byed par byed pa dngos po tha mi dad pa ba ltar rung ba @255b gcig ni med de /
translated: Although they are seen as different, there is no single entity that is suitable to be the distinguisher of tree and non-tree, which is seen in some and not seen in others.

original: de ni rnam par phye bas dbyug pa dang dbyug pa can bzhin du mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par phye bas dbyug pa dang dbyug pa can bzhin du mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is distinguished, it is not apprehended like a stick and its owner.

original: ma bzung ba yang nye bar ma mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bzung ba yang nye bar ma mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is not apprehended, it is not indicated.

original: gcig la mthong ba'i rnam pa yang gzhan la lta bar mi nus pa'i phyir de dang de ma yin pa dang ldan pa dag shing dang shing ma yin pa nyid yin na gsal ba gcig kho na shing yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig la mthong ba'i rnam pa yang gzhan la lta bar mi nus pa'i phyir de dang de ma yin pa dang ldan pa dag shing dang shing ma yin pa nyid yin na gsal ba gcig kho na shing yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because the aspect of seeing one thing cannot see another, if that and that which is not are endowed with tree and non-tree, then only one manifestation would be a tree.

original: 'dir yang sel ba'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pa rnams kyis dngos po med pa tsam gzhan sel ba'o zhes sgro btags nas sun 'byin byed par 'dod pas pha rol po rnams kyis gang smras pa de gzhan sel ba'i rang gi ngo bo legs par bshad pa
analyzed: 'dir yang sel ba'i rang gi ngo bo mi shes pa rnams kyis dngos po med pa tsam gzhan sel ba'o zhes sgro btags nas sun 'byin byed par 'dod pas pha rol po rnams kyis gang smras pa de gzhan sel ba'i rang gi ngo bo legs par bshad pa
translated: Here, those who do not understand the nature of exclusion superimpose the mere absence of one thing as the exclusion of another, and thus wish to refute it. Therefore, what the opponent says is explained well by the nature of exclusion itself.

original: kho nas gsal zhing pha rol man na te /
analyzed: kho nas gsal zhing pha rol man na te /
translated: It is clear that the opponent is defeated.

original: de sel ba'i ched du bdag nyid chen po rnams kyis so zhes pa shin tu 'phros pas chog go //
analyzed: de sel ba'i ched du bdag nyid chen po rnams kyis so zhes pa shin tu 'phros pas chog go //
translated: It is enough that the great ones have done this in order to refute that.

original: bshad do zhes pa don gyi rtogs par bya ba'i cha yang dag par bstan pas gzhan sel ba kho na sgra'i don du gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
analyzed: bshad do zhes pa don gyi rtogs par bya ba'i cha yang dag par bstan pas gzhan sel ba kho na sgra'i don du gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
translated: The word explains indicates that the meaning of a word is the exclusion of another, because it is the correct teaching of the part that is to be understood.

original: rnam mang zhes pa /
analyzed: rnam mang zhes pa /
translated: The word many means in spite of the many aspects.

original: shing sha pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis dang / me tog can dang 'bras bu can la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis rnam pa du ma nyid na yang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: shing sha pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis dang / me tog can dang 'bras bu can la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis rnam pa du ma nyid na yang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The word aspects means in spite of the many aspects, that is, in spite of the many aspects of the tree, such as the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ, and the many aspects of the flower, such as the jasmine.

original: brjod par bya ba zhes pa shing la sogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba zhes pa shing la sogs pa'i don to //
translated: The word object means tree and so on.

original: de ni nyid rnam pa du ma nyid na yang sgra las rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa med do ;
analyzed: de ni nyid rnam pa du ma nyid na yang sgra las rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa med do ;
translated: Even though it has many aspects, the word does not convey all aspects.

original: / rang dang 'brel pa rjes mthun las //
analyzed: / rang dang 'brel pa rjes mthun las //
translated: From the compatible connection with itself,

original: zhes pa la rang gi 'brel pa ni med na mi 'byung ba nyid de rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: zhes pa la rang gi 'brel pa ni med na mi 'byung ba nyid de rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Connection with itself means the invariable relation, which is characterized by positive and negative concomitance.

original: de yang de'i spyi la ltos nas yin gyi khyad par la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang de'i spyi la ltos nas yin gyi khyad par la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
translated: And that is in relation to its universal, not in relation to its particular.

original: de'i phyir 'brel ba gang 'dra ba rtogs par byed pa nyid kyang de 'dra ba kho nar rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel ba gang 'dra ba rtogs par byed pa nyid kyang de 'dra ba kho nar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is only reasonable that the understanding of the nature of the relation is also just like that.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: spyi la ltos nas 'di'i 'brel ba yin zhing /
analyzed: spyi la ltos nas 'di'i 'brel ba yin zhing /
translated: The relation of this [word] is in dependence on the universal.

original: spyi yang rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo kho nar ji skad bshad pa bzhin te /
analyzed: spyi yang rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo kho nar ji skad bshad pa bzhin te /
translated: And the universal is just as explained, the nature of exclusion.

original: ltos nas yin gyi khyad par la gzhan mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos nas yin gyi khyad par la gzhan mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in dependence [on the universal], because it is not reasonable for there to be another [universal] in the particulars.

original: de'i phyir rnam par gcod pa kho na byed cing rtogs par byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par gcod pa kho na byed cing rtogs par byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that [the word] only performs and is understood as an exclusion.

original: ci ste sgra yis cha ci zhig rtogs par byed ce na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ste sgra yis cha ci zhig rtogs par byed ce na gsungs pa /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhat part is understood by the word?‚Äù it is said:

original: sgra yang du ma'i chos ldan pa //
analyzed: sgra yang du ma'i chos ldan pa //
translated: The word also has many properties.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so on.

original: rang dang spyi'i chos rnams kyi chos du ma'o //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i chos rnams kyi chos du ma'o //
translated: The many properties are the properties of the individual and the universal.

original: gang gi don ni 'da' min pa //
analyzed: gang gi don ni 'da' min pa //
translated: The meaning of which is not passed over.

original: zhes pa spyi'i chos shing dang sgra nyid la sogs pa gang gis @256a * //
analyzed: zhes pa spyi'i chos shing dang sgra nyid la sogs pa gang gis @256a * //
translated: The universal properties of tree, sound, and so on, by which

original: 'khrul bar byed pa min zhing rtogs par byed pa de nyid kyis zhes pa 'dis chos de kho na rtogs par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'khrul bar byed pa min zhing rtogs par byed pa de nyid kyis zhes pa 'dis chos de kho na rtogs par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The word only indicates that it is not a delusion, and that it is the very thing that causes understanding. This means that it causes the understanding of that very reality of phenomena.

original: nyid kyi sgras ni gang rnam par bcad pa de bstan to //
analyzed: nyid kyi sgras ni gang rnam par bcad pa de bstan to //
translated: The word only indicates what is excluded.

original: sgra yi yon tan sogs kyis min //
analyzed: sgra yi yon tan sogs kyis min //
translated: It is not by the qualities of sound, etc.

original: zhes pa sogs kyi sgras sgra'i shes bya nyid la sogs pa rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa sogs kyi sgras sgra'i shes bya nyid la sogs pa rnams gzung ngo //
translated: Etc. includes being the object of the cognition of sound, and so on.

original: rtogs byed ma yin pa nyid ni de rnams la 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs byed ma yin pa nyid ni de rnams la 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The reason it is not the cause of understanding is because those are delusions.

original: de ltar ni de rnams ni shing gi don med kyang ro la sogs pa rnams la mthong gi / shing gi sgra nyid la sogs pa'i spyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni de rnams ni shing gi don med kyang ro la sogs pa rnams la mthong gi / shing gi sgra nyid la sogs pa'i spyi ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, although tree does not exist as an object, it is seen in relation to taste, etc., but not in relation to the universal tree sound, and so on.

original: gal te gzhan sel ba tsam zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te gzhan sel ba tsam zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: If it is said that it is mere exclusion of other, and so on.

original: 'dir bsam pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir bsam pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The intention here will be explained.

original: ci ltar zhes pa la sogs pa 'di ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes pa la sogs pa 'di ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the result of valid cognition.

original: dri bas bsam pa bsal bar bya ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: dri bas bsam pa bsal bar bya ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: In order to dispel the intended meaning of the question, it is said:

original: ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: How is it not so?

original: gang gi phyir tha dad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because of the difference, etc.

original: bsal bar bya ba tha dad pas ni lhan cig spyod pa las don tha dad pa ston to //
analyzed: bsal bar bya ba tha dad pas ni lhan cig spyod pa las don tha dad pa ston to //
translated: The difference in the object of reference shows the difference in the concomitants.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs te gang rnams don tha dad pa de rnams ni gzhi mthun pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs te gang rnams don tha dad pa de rnams ni gzhi mthun pa ma yin zhing /
translated: This is the reason: those which are different in meaning are not common substrates,

original: khyad par dang khyad par du bya bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par du bya bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: and they are not the qualified and the qualifier,

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin /
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin /
translated: like the words pot, cloth, etc.

original: sngon po dang autpala sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyang de lta bu'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang autpala sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyang de lta bu'o //
translated: The words blue, lotus, etc. are also like that.

original: khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: The contradiction with the pervasion.

original: de rnams kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: And those, etc.

original: gal te yang /
analyzed: gal te yang /
translated: Even if

original: bsal ba'i dbye bas don tha dad //
analyzed: bsal ba'i dbye bas don tha dad //
translated: the difference in meaning is due to the difference in the object of reference,

original: de lta na yang khyad par yod de /
analyzed: de lta na yang khyad par yod de /
translated: still there is a difference,

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: because

original: rang don dbye ba rtogs la rmongs //
analyzed: rang don dbye ba rtogs la rmongs //
translated: they are confused about the difference in their own meaning.

original: so sor zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: so sor zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: rang gi don ni spyi ste ;
analyzed: rang gi don ni spyi ste ;
translated: Their own meaning is the universal.

original: autpala'i sgra ni autpala tsam mo //
analyzed: autpala'i sgra ni autpala tsam mo //
translated: The word lotus is just a lotus.

original: de'i dbye ba ni autpala dmar po la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i dbye ba ni autpala dmar po la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Its divisions are the red lotus, etc.

original: sngon po tsam ste /
analyzed: sngon po tsam ste /
translated: Blue is just blue.

original: de'i dbye ba bung ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i dbye ba bung ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Its divisions are the bee, etc.

original: de rtogs la blun pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu rnams so //
analyzed: de rtogs la blun pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu rnams so //
translated: Understanding is the cause of doubt.üîΩFoolish is the cause of doubt.

original: 'dis ni so sor rang gi don gyi khyad par la the som gyi rgyu nyid de /
analyzed: 'dis ni so sor rang gi don gyi khyad par la the som gyi rgyu nyid de /
translated: This is the cause of doubt in the individual specific meanings,

original: don gyis go bas lhan cig pa rnams la nges pa'i rgyu nyid du bye brag smras so //
analyzed: don gyis go bas lhan cig pa rnams la nges pa'i rgyu nyid du bye brag smras so //
translated: but by implication it is the cause of certainty for those who are together.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra rnams phan tshun gyi don la rang gi don gyi bye brag la so sor the tshom gyi rgyu nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra rnams phan tshun gyi don la rang gi don gyi bye brag la so sor the tshom gyi rgyu nyid de /
translated: Because in this way, the words blue lotus, etc., are the cause of doubt in the individual specific meanings of each other's meanings,

original: lhan cig tu gyur pa rnams kho na la ni nges pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa de'i phyir autpala @256b sngon po zhes pa bya ba dngos po gcig la 'bras bu tha mi dad pa nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: lhan cig tu gyur pa rnams kho na la ni nges pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa de'i phyir autpala @256b sngon po zhes pa bya ba dngos po gcig la 'bras bu tha mi dad pa nyid yin zhing /
translated: but are the cause of certainty only for those who are together. Therefore, in one entity such as blue lotus, the effect is not different.

original: khyad par du byas pa'i don mngon par gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can du rigs te /
analyzed: khyad par du byas pa'i don mngon par gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can du rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable that the meaning of the word is characterized by the manifestation of a particular object,

original: de'i phyir gcig 'bras bu tha dad med pa nyid kyi phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid de de'i phyir yang khyad par byed pa dang khyad par bya ba'i dngos por 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig 'bras bu tha dad med pa nyid kyi phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid de de'i phyir yang khyad par byed pa dang khyad par bya ba'i dngos por 'thad do //
translated: because the effect of the word is not different from the word itself. Therefore, there is a common locus of the word and its meaning, and therefore it is reasonable that there is a relationship of qualifier and qualified.

original: ci ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ci ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is that?

original: autpala'i sgra rang gi don gyi khyad par la the tshom gyi rgyus /
analyzed: autpala'i sgra rang gi don gyi khyad par la the tshom gyi rgyus /
translated: The word ‚Äúlotus‚Äù is the cause of doubt about its meaning.

original: rang gi don spyi blos sgro btags pa la /
analyzed: rang gi don spyi blos sgro btags pa la /
translated: The word is superimposed on the meaning by the mind.

original: don de ni gzhan gyi rnam pa yongs su ma bcad pa can nyid kyi phyir na rnam pa gzhan du 'dod pa dang bcas pa'i blos yongs su gcad par bya ba ste ;
analyzed: don de ni gzhan gyi rnam pa yongs su ma bcad pa can nyid kyi phyir na rnam pa gzhan du 'dod pa dang bcas pa'i blos yongs su gcad par bya ba ste ;
translated: Because the meaning is not ascertained in another aspect, the mind that is desirous of another aspect ascertains it.

original: gang autpala 'di ci sngon po yin nam 'o na te gzhan dmar po la sogs pa yin zhes de'i phyir dogs pa gcad pa'i ched du sngon pa'i sgra sbyar bzhin pa ni gang autpala 'di ni sngon po ste /
analyzed: gang autpala 'di ci sngon po yin nam 'o na te gzhan dmar po la sogs pa yin zhes de'i phyir dogs pa gcad pa'i ched du sngon pa'i sgra sbyar bzhin pa ni gang autpala 'di ni sngon po ste /
translated: In order to eliminate doubt, the word ‚Äúblue‚Äù is applied to the lotus, as in ‚ÄúThis lotus is blue.‚Äù

original: dmar po ni ma yin no zhes de la rang gi don nye bar sdud cing autpala'i don khyad par du byed do zhes pas khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmar po ni ma yin no zhes de la rang gi don nye bar sdud cing autpala'i don khyad par du byed do zhes pas khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: The word blue is not the word red, and so it is a particular that excludes the meaning of blue and includes the meaning of lotus. Thus, there is a relation of qualifier and qualified.

original: 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The point here is this.

original: gang sgra rnams kyis brjod par bya ba ni blo la snang ba'i bdag nyid yin yang lhag par zhen pas phyi rol gyi don gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang sgra rnams kyis brjod par bya ba ni blo la snang ba'i bdag nyid yin yang lhag par zhen pas phyi rol gyi don gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Although what is expressed by words is the nature of what appears to the mind, due to attachment, it is the nature of an external object.

original: des na sgra'i don tha dad pa nye bar sdud pa na yang chos du ma rjes su song ba ni tha mi dad pa ltar snang ste /
analyzed: des na sgra'i don tha dad pa nye bar sdud pa na yang chos du ma rjes su song ba ni tha mi dad pa ltar snang ste /
translated: Therefore, when the different meanings of words are combined, many properties are included as if they were not different.

original: de las kyang autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis rnam pa de lta bu'i don gyi gzugs brnyan blo la gtod par byed cing dngos po gcig kho na autpala dang sngon po nyid la sogs pa'i chos du mar rab tu gsal bar byed do zhes pas
analyzed: de las kyang autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis rnam pa de lta bu'i don gyi gzugs brnyan blo la gtod par byed cing dngos po gcig kho na autpala dang sngon po nyid la sogs pa'i chos du mar rab tu gsal bar byed do zhes pas
translated: Moreover, words like blue lotus present to the mind an image of an object of that kind, and it is that very thing that is clearly indicated as having many properties such as being a lotus and being blue.

original: / tha snyad byed pa po 'khrul pa rnams kyis rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: / tha snyad byed pa po 'khrul pa rnams kyis rtogs par byed de /
translated: and it is understood by those who use conventions and are mistaken.

original: de'i phyir de rnams kyi rtogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzhi mthun pa nyid 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams kyi rtogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du gzhi mthun pa nyid 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in the fact that there is a common locus for the two, just as they are understood.

original: de ltar blo la yod pa'i sgra'i don de kho na ni sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra gang rung cig sbyar ba las sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gcig nges kyang bye brag gzhan ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir /üîΩgang sngon po 'di ci gang autpala 'am /
analyzed: de ltar blo la yod pa'i sgra'i don de kho na ni sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra gang rung cig sbyar ba las sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gcig nges kyang bye brag gzhan ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir / gang sngon po 'di ci gang autpala 'am /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the word that exists in the mind is ascertained as having the aspect of blue, for example, from the application of any word such as ‚Äúblue,‚Äù but the other particulars are not ascertained.

original: 'on te bung ba la sogs gzhan yin zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs pas bye brag gzhan du dogs pa dang bcas pa'i blos yongs su gcod par byed de /
analyzed: 'on te bung ba la sogs gzhan yin zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs pas bye brag gzhan du dogs pa dang bcas pa'i blos yongs su gcod par byed de /
translated: Therefore, the mind that has doubt about other particulars, such as ‚ÄúIs this blue? Is it a blue lotus? Or is it a bee?‚Äù and so on, ascertains it.

original: de'i phyir dogs pa gcad pa'i ched du sngon po'i sgra dang lhan cig tu sbyar bzhin @257a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir dogs pa gcad pa'i ched du sngon po'i sgra dang lhan cig tu sbyar bzhin @257a * //
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate doubt, the word ‚Äúblue‚Äù is applied together with the word ‚Äúlotus.‚Äù

original: pa autpala la sogs pa'i sgra sbyar bzhin pa rnams autpala sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: pa autpala la sogs pa'i sgra sbyar bzhin pa rnams autpala sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed cing /
translated: The words ‚Äúblue lotus‚Äù and so on generate a consciousness that appears as a blue lotus and so on,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi dngos po ni autpala ma yin pa la sogs pa don gzhan la rnam par gcod par byed do zhes lhag par zhen par byed do //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi dngos po ni autpala ma yin pa la sogs pa don gzhan la rnam par gcod par byed do zhes lhag par zhen par byed do //
translated: and one conceives of the entity that has the aspect of blue and so on as ‚Äúnot a lotus‚Äù and so on, which is a different object.

original: de'i phyir rtogs pa'i ngor byas pas khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba'i dngos po yang 'thad do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtogs pa'i ngor byas pas khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba'i dngos po yang 'thad do zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the entity that is the qualifier and the entity that is qualified are also tenable from the perspective of understanding.

original: bsal bar bya ba tha dad pa yod na yang zhes pa 'di yang sngar bzhin du bsal bya tha dad pas don tha dad par ston to //
analyzed: bsal bar bya ba tha dad pa yod na yang zhes pa 'di yang sngar bzhin du bsal bya tha dad pas don tha dad par ston to //
translated: Even if there is a difference in the object to be excluded, as before, the difference in the object to be excluded shows that the meaning is different.

original: rang gi don gyi khyad par gsal bar bya ba'i don du zhes pa /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi khyad par gsal bar bya ba'i don du zhes pa /
translated: For the purpose of clarifying the difference in their own meaning.

original: rang gi don gyi khyad par ni autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyi ni autpala sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi khyad par ni autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyi ni autpala sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The difference in their own meaning is the blue lotus and so on for the words ‚Äúblue lotus‚Äù and so on.

original: de mngon par gsal ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: de mngon par gsal ba'i don du ste /
translated: For the sake of manifesting that.

original: 'dis ni 'bras bu tha dad med pa nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'bras bu tha dad med pa nyid gsungs so //
translated: This teaches that the effect is not different.

original: 'greng ba dang bya rog gnas pa bzhin du rang bsal ba'i don du zhes pa /
analyzed: 'greng ba dang bya rog gnas pa bzhin du rang bsal ba'i don du zhes pa /
translated: Like a standing crow, for the sake of self-elimination.

original: sngon po'i spyi dang autpala'i spyi'o //
analyzed: sngon po'i spyi dang autpala'i spyi'o //
translated: The universal of blue and the universal of lotus.

original: gcig la sdud par byed pa rnams zhes pa /
analyzed: gcig la sdud par byed pa rnams zhes pa /
translated: Those that combine in one.

original: autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i don gyi khyad par la khyad par du byed pa nyid du bshad pa'i autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra lhan cig sbyar ba rnams ni autpala sngon po la sogs par snang ba /
analyzed: autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i don gyi khyad par la khyad par du byed pa nyid du bshad pa'i autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra lhan cig sbyar ba rnams ni autpala sngon po la sogs par snang ba /
translated: The words blue lotus, etc., which are explained as the very differentiators of the particular objects such as blue lotus, etc., when combined together, appear as blue lotus, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa la gtod par byed cing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la gtod par byed cing /
translated: They direct the consciousness to the object.

original: autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i don la rang gi don gyi spyi autpala sngon po la sogs pa ni khyad par du byed pa nyid du nye bar sdud par byed pa po rnams rtogs pa po rnams kyis rab tu rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i don la rang gi don gyi spyi autpala sngon po la sogs pa ni khyad par du byed pa nyid du nye bar sdud par byed pa po rnams rtogs pa po rnams kyis rab tu rtogs par byed de /
translated: Those who combine the universal of blue lotus, etc., which is the universal of its own object, as the very differentiators, understand that.

original: de'i phyir de'i rtogs pa'i dbang las de skad du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rtogs pa'i dbang las de skad du bshad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is explained in this way from the perspective of the cognition of that.

original: 'greng ba nyid ni 'greng ba ma yin pa rnam par gcod pas bsgreng ba'i spyi rtogs par byed cing /
analyzed: 'greng ba nyid ni 'greng ba ma yin pa rnam par gcod pas bsgreng ba'i spyi rtogs par byed cing /
translated: Standing is the cognition of the universal of standing through the exclusion of nonstanding.

original: tho yor dang mi la sogs pa 'greng ba'i khyad par la the tshom gyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: tho yor dang mi la sogs pa 'greng ba'i khyad par la the tshom gyi rgyu ste /
translated: It is the cause of doubt regarding the particulars of standing, such as a scarecrow and a person.

original: bya rog gnas pa yang bya rog gi rten du mi rung ba'i dngos po rnam par gcod pas bya rog gnas par rung ba'i dngos po tsam rtogs par byed cing /
analyzed: bya rog gnas pa yang bya rog gi rten du mi rung ba'i dngos po rnam par gcod pas bya rog gnas par rung ba'i dngos po tsam rtogs par byed cing /
translated: A crow‚Äôs perch is the cognition of the mere thing that is suitable to be a crow‚Äôs perch through the exclusion of things that are not suitable to be a crow‚Äôs perch.

original: de'i khyad par tho yor dang thang la sogs pa rnams la the tshom gyi rgyu yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i khyad par tho yor dang thang la sogs pa rnams la the tshom gyi rgyu yin zhing /
translated: It is the cause of doubt regarding its particulars, such as a scarecrow and the ground.

original: de dag lhan cig byas pa dag ni skyes bu'i gzugs ma yin pa'i 'greng ba nyid kyi bye brag la nges pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir gzhi mthun par 'gyur ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag lhan cig byas pa dag ni skyes bu'i gzugs ma yin pa'i 'greng ba nyid kyi bye brag la nges pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir gzhi mthun par 'gyur ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Since those are the causes of ascertaining the particulars of standing that are not the form of a person, they are similar in being common loci.

original: autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra rnams don gcig la sngar @257b brjod pa'i rnam pas nger par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra rnams don gcig la sngar @257b brjod pa'i rnam pas nger par 'gyur ro //
translated: The words blue lotus and so on are ascertained with respect to a single object by the previously mentioned method.

original: de ltar ni de rnams zhes pa so so ba ni rang gi don gyi khyad par la the tshom gyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni de rnams zhes pa so so ba ni rang gi don gyi khyad par la the tshom gyi rgyu ste /
translated: In that case, those means that individually they are the cause of doubt with respect to the particular of their own object.

original: don gyis go bas lhan cig byas pa rnams ni nges pa'i rgyu nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: don gyis go bas lhan cig byas pa rnams ni nges pa'i rgyu nyid du gsungs so //
translated: By the meaning, it is said that collectively they are the cause of ascertainment.

original: gang gi phyir autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra rnams so so ba ni rang gi don gyi bye brag la the tshom gyi rgyu rnams te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra rnams so so ba ni rang gi don gyi bye brag la the tshom gyi rgyu rnams te /
translated: Because the words blue lotus and so on individually are the cause of doubt with respect to the particular of their own object,

original: lhan cig byas pa rnams kho na ni nges pa'i rgyu yin pa de'i phyir lhan cig pa rnam ni rang gi don gyi khyad par don gcig gsal bar byed pa rnams gzhi mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byas pa rnams kho na ni nges pa'i rgyu yin pa de'i phyir lhan cig pa rnam ni rang gi don gyi khyad par don gcig gsal bar byed pa rnams gzhi mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: collectively they are the cause of ascertainment. Therefore, collectively they clarify the single object, the particular of their own object, and they become a common locus.

original: sgra gzhan dang lhan cig pa'i gsal bar bya ba'i don mi srid pa'i phyir yang zhes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: sgra gzhan dang lhan cig pa'i gsal bar bya ba'i don mi srid pa'i phyir yang zhes pa la sogs pa /
translated: Also and so on is because it is impossible for the object to be clarified to be together with another word.

original: sgra gzhan sngon po'i sgra dang lhan cig pa'i autpala'i sgra'i gsal bar bya ba'i gang khyad par can gyi don de ni autpala'i sgra 'ba' zhig ba la srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra gzhan sngon po'i sgra dang lhan cig pa'i autpala'i sgra'i gsal bar bya ba'i gang khyad par can gyi don de ni autpala'i sgra 'ba' zhig ba la srid pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning that is to be clarified by the word lotus, which is associated with the word blue, is not possible with the word lotus alone.

original: de bzhin du sngon po'i sgra la yang autpala'i sgra dang lhan cig pa'i gsal bar bya ba gang yin pa de 'ba' zhig pa la mi srid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon po'i sgra la yang autpala'i sgra dang lhan cig pa'i gsal bar bya ba gang yin pa de 'ba' zhig pa la mi srid do zhes pa'o //
translated: And similarly, the meaning that is to be clarified by the word blue, which is associated with the word lotus, is not possible with the word blue alone.

original: sgra gzhan nye bas khyad par du byas pa'i don la 'jug pa'i phyir phan tshun khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: sgra gzhan nye bas khyad par du byas pa'i don la 'jug pa'i phyir phan tshun khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: Because the meaning is applied as qualified by the other word, there is a mutual relationship of qualifier and qualified.

original: dper na 'greng pa nyid dang bya rog gnas pa dag ni lhan cig pa dag kho na khyad par du byas pa'i don rtogs par byed pa dag yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'greng pa nyid dang bya rog gnas pa dag ni lhan cig pa dag kho na khyad par du byas pa'i don rtogs par byed pa dag yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the words standing and crow are understood to have a qualified meaning only when they are used together.

original: don rnams kho na'i khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba'i dngos por 'jig rten na grags kyi /
analyzed: don rnams kho na'i khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba'i dngos por 'jig rten na grags kyi /
translated: In the world, it is known that only meanings have the relationship of qualifier and qualified.

original: sgra rnams la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra rnams la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not known that words have this relationship.

original: des na ci ltar de rnams la de ci ltar rnam par gzhag ces dogs par byas nas gyur pa smos pa ste /üîΩgyur pa'i sgra ni dpe rjod par byed pa don du gyur pa kho na'i chos te /
analyzed: des na ci ltar de rnams la de ci ltar rnam par gzhag ces dogs par byas nas gyur pa smos pa ste / gyur pa'i sgra ni dpe rjod par byed pa don du gyur pa kho na'i chos te /
translated: Therefore, how can they be established as that?üîΩThe word ‚Äúlike‚Äù expresses an example, and it is a word that is applied to a meaning that is similar to another.

original: de rjod par byed pa'i sgrar nye bar gdags par bya'o zhes gyur pa'i sgra'i don to //
analyzed: de rjod par byed pa'i sgrar nye bar gdags par bya'o zhes gyur pa'i sgra'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of the word ‚Äúlike.‚Äù

original: des na 'dis ni gzhi mthun pa nyid yod na yang khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba'i dngos po dag kyang bsgreng ba dang bya rog gnas pa la sogs pa rnams la mthong ba'i phyir gtan tshigs 'khrul par gsungs so //
analyzed: des na 'dis ni gzhi mthun pa nyid yod na yang khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba'i dngos po dag kyang bsgreng ba dang bya rog gnas pa la sogs pa rnams la mthong ba'i phyir gtan tshigs 'khrul par gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, this passage explains that the reason is mistaken because when there is a common locus, there is a difference between the thing that is distinguished and the thing that distinguishes it, as is seen in the case of ‚Äúthe crow‚Äôs nest on the top of the tree.‚Äù

original: 'on gzhi gcig pa can gang yin pa de zhes pa /
analyzed: 'on gzhi gcig pa can gang yin pa de zhes pa /
translated: ‚ÄúBut if something is a common locus, then‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: tshig rnam par sbyor ba'i dus na sngon po yang de yin la autpala yang ngo zhes byed de /
analyzed: tshig rnam par sbyor ba'i dus na sngon po yang de yin la autpala yang ngo zhes byed de /
translated: When the words are connected, it is said that ‚Äúblue‚Äù is that and ‚Äúlotus‚Äù is that.

original: de'i phyir dri ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dri ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a question.

original: 'dis ni gang brjod pa sgra gzhan dang lhan cig pa kho na'i sgra yis khyad par du byas pa'i don gsal bar bya'o zhes pa 'di la khas blangs pas gnod pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni gang brjod pa sgra gzhan dang lhan cig pa kho na'i sgra yis khyad par du byas pa'i don gsal bar bya'o zhes pa 'di la khas blangs pas gnod pa gsungs so //
translated: This shows that the assertion that the meaning distinguished by the word alone, in combination with another word, is to be expressed, is undermined.

original: de ni sngon po 'ba' zhig min //
analyzed: de ni sngon po 'ba' zhig min //
translated: It is not just blue.

original: zhes pa @258a * //
analyzed: zhes pa @258a * //
translated: ThisüîΩshows that the meaning distinguished by the word blue alone is not to be expressed.

original: sngon po 'ba' zhig pa bkag pas sngon po'i sgra tsam gyi brjod bar bya ba nyid 'gegs so //
analyzed: sngon po 'ba' zhig pa bkag pas sngon po'i sgra tsam gyi brjod bar bya ba nyid 'gegs so //
translated: By negating ‚Äújust blue,‚Äù he negates that it is the mere referent of the word blue.

original: de bzhin du autpala 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin zhes pas autpala'i sgra tsam gyi brjod par bya ba nyid 'ba' zhig pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du autpala 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin zhes pas autpala'i sgra tsam gyi brjod par bya ba nyid 'ba' zhig pa'o //
translated: Similarly, by saying ‚Äúnot just a lotus,‚Äù he shows that it is not the mere referent of the word lotus.

original: de ltar na sngon po'i sgra 'ba' zhig pa dang autpala'i sgra 'ba' zhig pa gang brjod par bya ba de 'jig rten na sngon po 'ba' zhig pa dang autpala 'ba' zhig pa'o zhes grags so //
analyzed: de ltar na sngon po'i sgra 'ba' zhig pa dang autpala'i sgra 'ba' zhig pa gang brjod par bya ba de 'jig rten na sngon po 'ba' zhig pa dang autpala 'ba' zhig pa'o zhes grags so //
translated: Thus, the mere word blue and the mere word lotus are not the referents of those words. In the world, it is known that ‚Äújust blue‚Äù and ‚Äújust a lotus‚Äù are blue and a lotus.

original: yang ci'i phyir sngon po dang autpala'i sgra 'ba' zhig ba dag gis de brjod par bya ba ma yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir sngon po dang autpala'i sgra 'ba' zhig ba dag gis de brjod par bya ba ma yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Why is it that the mere words blue and lotus are not the referents of those words? He says:

original: tshogs pa brjod bya nyid yin phyir //
analyzed: tshogs pa brjod bya nyid yin phyir //
translated: Because the collection is the object of expression.

original: zhes pa gang gi phyir lhan cig byas pa dag kho na'i sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag gis don de brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa gang gi phyir lhan cig byas pa dag kho na'i sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag gis don de brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: Because only the co-produced words ‚Äúblue‚Äù and ‚Äúlotus‚Äù express that meaning,

original: 'ba' zhig bdag gis ma yin pas te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig bdag gis ma yin pas te /
translated: not the individual words.

original: gzhan du na gcig gis don de rjod par byed ba nyid na rnam grangs pa'i sgra ltar de dag lhan cig sbyor ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan du na gcig gis don de rjod par byed ba nyid na rnam grangs pa'i sgra ltar de dag lhan cig sbyor ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Otherwise, when one of them expresses that meaning, it would be untenable for them to be combined, like the words ‚Äúone‚Äù and ‚Äútwo.‚Äù

original: des na 'dis ni tshig rnam par sbyor ba'i dus na yang lhan cig pa kho na'i sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag gis de brjod par bya'o zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pas gnod pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: des na 'dis ni tshig rnam par sbyor ba'i dus na yang lhan cig pa kho na'i sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag gis de brjod par bya'o zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pas gnod pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, this shows that even at the time of combining the words, only the words ‚Äúblue‚Äù and ‚Äúlotus‚Äù together express that meaning. Thus, it is not undermined by what is accepted.

original: 'o na 'ba' zhig ba dag gis ci zhig rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na 'ba' zhig ba dag gis ci zhig rtogs she na /
translated: If that is so, what is understood by the individual words?

original: cung zad kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: cung zad kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nothing at all.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: yi ge bzhin du de don med yang cha shas rnams la don med pa nyid na ci ltar de tshogs pa don dang ldan pa nyid yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: yi ge bzhin du de don med yang cha shas rnams la don med pa nyid na ci ltar de tshogs pa don dang ldan pa nyid yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: If the meaning of the word is nonexistent, and the parts are also nonexistent, how can the collection of them have meaning?üîΩThe response to that is:

original: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Just as, etc.

original: mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa zhes pas /
analyzed: mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa zhes pas /
translated: By saying ‚Äúan inappropriate example,‚Äù

original: dpe mi mtshungs pa nyid smras so //
analyzed: dpe mi mtshungs pa nyid smras so //
translated: he says that the example is not similar.

original: ci ltar mi mtshungs pa yin zhe na smras pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci ltar mi mtshungs pa yin zhe na smras pa ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: How is it not similar? He says, ‚ÄúNo, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni khas blangs pa nyams pa nyid smras te /
analyzed: 'dis ni khas blangs pa nyams pa nyid smras te /
translated: By this he says that the assertion is undermined.

original: sngon po'i sgra 'ba' zhig pa yang don dang ldan pa nyid du khas blangs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po'i sgra 'ba' zhig pa yang don dang ldan pa nyid du khas blangs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he asserts that the mere word ‚Äúblue‚Äù has meaning.

original: yig la don 'ga' med pa ste //
analyzed: yig la don 'ga' med pa ste //
translated: There is no meaning in the letters,

original: tshig gnyis pa ni rtogs she na //
analyzed: tshig gnyis pa ni rtogs she na //
translated: but the second word is understood.

original: skyon 'di med de gang gi phyir //
analyzed: skyon 'di med de gang gi phyir //
translated: This fault does not exist, because

original: de yis brjod bya zhes der yang //
analyzed: de yis brjod bya zhes der yang //
translated: by that, the object of expression is also

original: 'ba' zhig yang dag rtogs par bya //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig yang dag rtogs par bya //
translated: only correctly understood.

original: sngon po'i sgra dar yang don gang rtogs par bya ba de sngon po'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'o zhes pa 'ba' zhig brtogs  kyi / tshogs pa'i don ni sngon po'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du rtogs par bya ba ma yin no zhes ba'i don to
analyzed: sngon po'i sgra dar yang don gang rtogs par bya ba de sngon po'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'o zhes pa 'ba' zhig brtogs  kyi / tshogs pa'i don ni sngon po'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du rtogs par bya ba ma yin no zhes ba'i don to
translated: But when the word blue is uttered, only that which is to be understood is understood to be the referent of the word blue, and the referent of the collection is not understood to be the referent of the word blue.üîΩ That is the meaning.

original: // de nyid kyi phyir tshogs pa'i don gyis stong pa nyid du 'ba' @258b zhig pa dag ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: // de nyid kyi phyir tshogs pa'i don gyis stong pa nyid du 'ba' @258b zhig pa dag ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said that the referent of the collection is empty, and only the individual words are taught.

original: ji ltar kho nar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //üîΩgang bshad pa zhes pa la sogs pas phyogs snga ma so sor brjod nas /
analyzed: ji ltar kho nar zhes pa la sogs pa'o // gang bshad pa zhes pa la sogs pas phyogs snga ma so sor brjod nas /
translated: As it is said, just as... and so on.üîΩ Having stated the opponent's position with what was explained... and so on,

original: de la yang zhes pa la sogs pas de'i brjod bya zhes pa la sogs pa phyed phyi ma'i don 'chad do //
analyzed: de la yang zhes pa la sogs pas de'i brjod bya zhes pa la sogs pa phyed phyi ma'i don 'chad do //
translated: he explains the meaning of the latter half, beginning with there... and so on.

original: rigs ni sngon po'i yon tan dang 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi sngon po nyid do //
analyzed: rigs ni sngon po'i yon tan dang 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi sngon po nyid do //
translated: The class is the blue itself that is the collection of the quality of blueness.

original: 'ba' zhig pa smos pas tshogs pa'i don gyis stong pa nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa smos pas tshogs pa'i don gyis stong pa nyid gsungs so //
translated: By mentioning only, he says that the referent of the collection is empty.

original: sngon po'i sgras brjod par bya bas ni /
analyzed: sngon po'i sgras brjod par bya bas ni /
translated: The meaning expressed by the word ‚Äúblue‚Äù is

original: gang la de 'phrod pa 'dus pa rigs dang sbyar ba'i yon tan nam /
analyzed: gang la de 'phrod pa 'dus pa rigs dang sbyar ba'i yon tan nam /
translated: the substance that is connected with the quality that is suitable to be connected with that.

original: gang la sngon po'i yon tan 'phrod ba 'dus pa rigs dang sbyar ba'i yon tan dang sbyar ba'i rdzas te /
analyzed: gang la sngon po'i yon tan 'phrod ba 'dus pa rigs dang sbyar ba'i yon tan dang sbyar ba'i rdzas te /
translated: Or, the meaning expressed by the word ‚Äúblue‚Äù is the substance that is connected with the quality of blueness that is suitable to be connected with that.

original: 'di thams cad kyang tshogs pa'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyang tshogs pa'i don ma yin no //
translated: None of these is the meaning of ‚Äúcollection.‚Äù

original: de ltar na gnyis kar yang tshogs pa'i brjod par bya ba'i don gyis don med pa nyid mngon bar brjod pa nyid kyi phyir mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa nyid med cing dam bca' ba la khas blangs bas gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyis kar yang tshogs pa'i brjod par bya ba'i don gyis don med pa nyid mngon bar brjod pa nyid kyi phyir mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa nyid med cing dam bca' ba la khas blangs bas gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, in both cases, since the meaning expressed by the word ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is clearly meaningless, the mere statement of a counterexample does not exist, and the thesis is not undermined by what is accepted.

original: de'i phyir don gyis stong pa rnams kyis zhes pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyis stong pa rnams kyis zhes pa /
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúby those that are empty of meaning‚Äù

original: tshogs pa'i don gyis stong pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i don gyis stong pa rnams kyis so //
translated: means by those that are empty of the meaning of collection.

original: tshogs pa rnams kyis zhes pa sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis so //
analyzed: tshogs pa rnams kyis zhes pa sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy collections‚Äù means by the words ‚Äúblue‚Äù and so on.

original: 'o na ; bsal bya'i dbye bas don tha dang // ces pa brjod par bya ba rnams so zhes pa ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa ;
analyzed: 'o na ; bsal bya'i dbye bas don tha dang // ces pa brjod par bya ba rnams so zhes pa ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa ;
translated: But then, how is it that the passage, ‚ÄúThe objects of expression are the divisions of the objects of exclusion,‚Äù is explained as ‚ÄúThe objects of expression are the objects of exclusion‚Äù?üîΩIt is said:

original: sgra tha dad pa'i brjod par bya bas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sgra tha dad pa'i brjod par bya bas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The objects of expression are different by virtue of the difference of the terms.

original: tha dad par ni so sor gyur ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad par ni so sor gyur ba ste /
translated: Different means individually.

original: 'ba' zhig pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúalone.‚Äù

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being said.üîΩThe objects of expression of the terms ‚Äúalone‚Äù such as ‚Äúblue‚Äù are different.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i 'ba' zhig pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i don gyis tha dad ces pa brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i 'ba' zhig pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i don gyis tha dad ces pa brjod par bya'i /
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúdifferent.‚Äù

original: tshogs ba'i don gyis ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs ba'i don gyis ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: But it is not the case that the objects of expression of the term ‚Äúcollection‚Äù are different.

original: gal te de lta na tshogs pa'i brjod par bya ba kho na khyad par du byas pa'i don yin na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na tshogs pa'i brjod par bya ba kho na khyad par du byas pa'i don yin na /
translated: If that is so, then since the object of expression of the term ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is the object that is qualified,

original: de ci ltar gzhi mthun ba nyid dam khyad par dang khyad par du byas pa'i dngos po'i bar yin te /
analyzed: de ci ltar gzhi mthun ba nyid dam khyad par dang khyad par du byas pa'i dngos po'i bar yin te /
translated: how can it be the common locus of the qualifier and the qualified?

original: 'di gnyis ka ni tha dad pa'i rten can yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka ni tha dad pa'i rten can yin zhing /
translated: Because these two are based on different things.

original: tshogs ba yang gcig yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshogs ba yang gcig yin no zhe na /
translated: But the collection is one.

original: yongs su brtags nas sgro btags pa'i cha shas yod par gyur ba'i phyir gnyis ka rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su brtags nas sgro btags pa'i cha shas yod par gyur ba'i phyir gnyis ka rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Because of the existence of the part that is imputed by postulation, both are to be posited.

original: 'di ni sel ba'i sgo la gang 'di'i 'di dag las don du brtags pa'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sel ba'i sgo la gang 'di'i 'di dag las don du brtags pa'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the explanation of the exclusion-way, ‚ÄúThese are the imputations of the object by these.‚Äù

original: rtogs ba po'i bsam pa'i dbang las yang na ste /
analyzed: rtogs ba po'i bsam pa'i dbang las yang na ste /
translated: Or, it is from the power of the thought of the cognizer.

original: rtogs pa bo @259a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa bo @259a * //
translated: The cognizers

original: rnams ni khyad par dang khyad par can gnyi ga can gyi don gcig kho na la sgra gnyis po 'di dag ni so sor rjod par byed pa dag go zhes sems par byed da /
analyzed: rnams ni khyad par dang khyad par can gnyi ga can gyi don gcig kho na la sgra gnyis po 'di dag ni so sor rjod par byed pa dag go zhes sems par byed da /
translated: think that these two words are used separately for just the single object that has both the qualifier and the qualified.

original: de'i phyir de rnams kyi bsam pa'i dbang las de ltar rnam par gzhag par bya'o //üîΩdon gzhan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams kyi bsam pa'i dbang las de ltar rnam par gzhag par bya'o // don gzhan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is to be posited in that way from the power of their thought.

original: gal te gzhan sel ba las gzhan rigs la sogs pa brjod par bya bar 'dod na'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhan sel ba las gzhan rigs la sogs pa brjod par bya bar 'dod na'o //
translated: If one wishes to express a class, etc., that is different from the exclusion of other,

original: yan lag gi don dag ces pa sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra 'ba' zhig pa'i brjod par bya ba dag go //
analyzed: yan lag gi don dag ces pa sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra 'ba' zhig pa'i brjod par bya ba dag go //
translated: the meanings of the parts are the objects of expression of the words ‚Äúblue,‚Äù etc., alone.

original: de dag gi gzhi ni tshogs pa'i brjod par bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhi ni tshogs pa'i brjod par bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: The basis of those is the referent of the expression ‚Äúcollection.‚Äù

original: de las zhes pa yan lag gi don de dag las so//
analyzed: de las zhes pa yan lag gi don de dag las so//
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from those subsidiary referents.

original: tha dad par 'gyur ba'am tha mi dad pa zhes pa rdzas su yod pa la rnam par rtog pa gsum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par 'gyur ba'am tha mi dad pa zhes pa rdzas su yod pa la rnam par rtog pa gsum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEither different or non-different‚Äù is because there is no third alternative for substantial existence.

original: de la tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la skyon nye bar bstan pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la skyon nye bar bstan pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: There, in order to demonstrate the fault in the position of non-difference, it is said:

original: tshogs pa gcig nyid yod ma yin //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig nyid yod ma yin //
translated: A single collection does not exist.

original: zhes pa ste ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pa ste ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phan tshun khyad par med thal phyir //
analyzed: phan tshun khyad par med thal phyir //
translated: Because it follows that they are mutually indistinguishable.

original: tshogs pa can dag phan tshun tha dad med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tshogs pa can dag phan tshun tha dad med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it follows that the members of the collection are mutually indistinguishable.

original: gal te zhes pa la sogs pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i don du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes pa la sogs pas tshig le'ur byas pa'i don du gsungs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse is stated by ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'di ni 'dir bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: This is the condensed meaning here.

original: gang tshogs pa gcig las gzhan ma yin pa de ni tha mi dad pa ste /
analyzed: gang tshogs pa gcig las gzhan ma yin pa de ni tha mi dad pa ste /
translated: That which is not different from a single collection is non-different.

original: tshogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin //
translated: Like the nature of the collection itself.

original: yon tan sngon po dang rigs autpala dag kyang autpala sngon po zhes pa'i tshogs pa gcig las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan sngon po dang rigs autpala dag kyang autpala sngon po zhes pa'i tshogs pa gcig las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The qualities blue and the type lotus are not the same as the collection of blue lotus.

original: rang bzhin gyis thal bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis thal bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The consequence of being essentially different is

original: de ltar yang ma yin no zhes pa bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin no zhes pa bzlog pa'o //
translated: that they are not the same.

original: gang dag phan tshun tha dad pa de dag autpala sngon po las gzhan ma yin pa ma yin te ba lang dang rta bzhin yon tan sngon po dang rigs autpala dag kyang phan tshun tha dad pa dag go zhes pa khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag phan tshun tha dad pa de dag autpala sngon po las gzhan ma yin pa ma yin te ba lang dang rta bzhin yon tan sngon po dang rigs autpala dag kyang phan tshun tha dad pa dag go zhes pa khyab byed dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: That which is essentially different from something is not the same as that, like a cow and a horse. The qualities blue and the type lotus are essentially different from each other.

original: tshogs pa du ma nyid thal phyir //
analyzed: tshogs pa du ma nyid thal phyir //
translated: The consequence of being a pluralityüîΩis that they are not the same.

original: zhes pa tshogs pa gcig gi bdag nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes dkyus ma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa tshogs pa gcig gi bdag nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes dkyus ma'o //
translated: The point of the passage is that they are not the same in being the nature of a single collection.

original: tshogs pa ste rigs dang yon tan tshogs la yan lag du ma las tha mi dad pa'i phyir du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa ste rigs dang yon tan tshogs la yan lag du ma las tha mi dad pa'i phyir du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The collection of the type and the qualities is not essentially different from the many parts. Therefore, the consequence of being a plurality would follow.

original: gang du ma tshogs pa de ni dngos po ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang du ma tshogs pa de ni dngos po ba ma yin gyi /
translated: That which is not a plurality is not a thing.

original: brtags pa pa kho na ste grong drug bzhin no //üîΩsngon po dang autpala'i don can dag gi zhes pa 'bru mang po pa ste /
analyzed: brtags pa pa kho na ste grong drug bzhin no // sngon po dang autpala'i don can dag gi zhes pa 'bru mang po pa ste /
translated: It is only a nominal one, like the six villages.üîΩThe meaning of the words ‚Äúof the words that have the meaning of blue and lotus‚Äù is a plural particle.

original: sngon po dang autpala rjod par byed pa'i sgra dag gi zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sngon po dang autpala rjod par byed pa'i sgra dag gi zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúof the words that express blue and lotus.‚Äù

original: gcig la yang 'jug bzhin @259b pa dag ni zhes pa sgra'i tshogs pa gcig la yan lag gi dngos pos 'jug bzhin pa dag ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: gcig la yang 'jug bzhin @259b pa dag ni zhes pa sgra'i tshogs pa gcig la yan lag gi dngos pos 'jug bzhin pa dag ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwhile being engaged in one‚Äù is ‚Äúwhile being engaged in one collection of words by way of the parts.‚Äù

original: ci las gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur zhes pa don tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: ci las gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur zhes pa don tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúHow can there be a common locus?‚Äù is because of the difference in meaning.

original: dper na bum pa dang snam bu'i sgra dag la gzhi mthun pa nyid med pa de ltar sngon po dang autpala'i sgra tshogs zin pa dag la yang ngo zhes pa khyab byed dang 'gal ba gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang snam bu'i sgra dag la gzhi mthun pa nyid med pa de ltar sngon po dang autpala'i sgra tshogs zin pa dag la yang ngo zhes pa khyab byed dang 'gal ba gsal bar byed do //
translated: Just as the words pot and cloth do not have a common locus, so also the collection of the words blue and lotus do not. This clarifies the contradiction with the pervader.

original: khyad par ni spyi'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir zhes pa /
analyzed: khyad par ni spyi'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir zhes pa /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the particular is included within the general‚Äù means

original: sngon po zhes pa spyi ste /
analyzed: sngon po zhes pa spyi ste /
translated: ‚Äúblue‚Äù is a general term.

original: de'i khyad par rnams ni autpala la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i khyad par rnams ni autpala la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The particulars of that are the lotus, etc.

original: de rnams der nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: de rnams der nang du 'dus so //
translated: Those are included in that.

original: sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag ni spyi rjod bar byed pa dag ste /
analyzed: sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag ni spyi rjod bar byed pa dag ste /
translated: The words blue and lotus are general expressions.

original: khyad par nang du 'dus nas 'jug pa dag go //
analyzed: khyad par nang du 'dus nas 'jug pa dag go //
translated: The particulars are included in that and are applied.

original: de'i phyir khyad par rnams spyi'i nang du 'dus pa'o zhes pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par rnams spyi'i nang du 'dus pa'o zhes pas /
translated: Therefore, the particulars are included in the general.

original: de rnams kyang sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag gi don rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyang sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag gi don rnams so //
translated: Those are also the referents of the words blue and lotus.

original: de ltar sngon po dang autpala'i sgra gnyis ka dag kyang autpala sngon po don dang ldan pa dag go //
analyzed: de ltar sngon po dang autpala'i sgra gnyis ka dag kyang autpala sngon po don dang ldan pa dag go //
translated: Thus, both the words blue and lotus are meaningful in regard to the blue lotus.

original: de las kyang rang gi don yongs su mi spong na yang skyon cung zad kyang med do //üîΩgal te 'o na spyi'i sgra yang khyad par gyi don can te /
analyzed: de las kyang rang gi don yongs su mi spong na yang skyon cung zad kyang med do // gal te 'o na spyi'i sgra yang khyad par gyi don can te /
translated: Even if they do not completely abandon their own referent, there is not the slightest fault.

original: de kho na las khyad par rtogs pa'i phyir sgra gnyis pa sbyor ba spyi'i don du yin zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de kho na las khyad par rtogs pa'i phyir sgra gnyis pa sbyor ba spyi'i don du yin zhe na smras pa /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWell then, the general word also has the meaning of a particular, because the particular is understood from that alone, the application of the second word is for the sake of the general meaning,‚Äù we say:

original: 'dra ba'i ngo bo dag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i ngo bo dag ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The same entity, etc.

original: ngo bo gang gis sngon po'i sgra sngon po nyid rjod pa de kho nas autpala sngon po yang ngo //
analyzed: ngo bo gang gis sngon po'i sgra sngon po nyid rjod pa de kho nas autpala sngon po yang ngo //
translated: By the entity by which the word blue expresses blueness, that very [entity] expresses blue lotus.

original: de'i phyir ngo bo mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ci 'di spyi'i don kho na'am 'on te khyad par gyi don yang yin zhes mi shas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ci 'di spyi'i don kho na'am 'on te khyad par gyi don yang yin zhes mi shas te /
translated: Therefore, because of the sameness of entity, one does not know whether this [word] has the meaning of a universal only or also the meaning of a particular.

original: khyad par gyi don dang ldan pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i don du sgra'i sbyor ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi don dang ldan pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i don du sgra'i sbyor ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second application of the word is for the purpose of making known that it has the meaning of a particular.

original: 'dir re zhig ces ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩsngon po'i sgras ni sngon po'i rigs sam /üîΩde dang sbyor ba'i yon tan brjod par bya'i autpala la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rigs ni ma yin pas te /
analyzed: 'dir re zhig ces ba la sogs pa ste / sngon po'i sgras ni sngon po'i rigs sam / de dang sbyor ba'i yon tan brjod par bya'i autpala la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rigs ni ma yin pas te /
translated: Here, he says, etc.üîΩThe word blue expresses the class of blue or the quality that is associated with it, but not the class of substances such as lotus, etc.

original: de las kyang autpala dmar po la sogs pa rnams ni yon tan sngon po 'am de la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i sngon po nyid kyi ma yin te /
analyzed: de las kyang autpala dmar po la sogs pa rnams ni yon tan sngon po 'am de la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i sngon po nyid kyi ma yin te /
translated: And even from that, red lotus, etc. are not the blueness of the quality or the blueness of the collection that is suitable for it.

original: des na ci ltar sngon po'i sgra'i don gyi nang du autpala sngon po la sogs pa rnams 'du par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ci ltar sngon po'i sgra'i don gyi nang du autpala sngon po la sogs pa rnams 'du par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could the blue lotus and so on be included in the meaning of the word blue?

original: spyis brjod pa zhes pas tha mi dad pa'i sgra'i don smras so //
analyzed: spyis brjod pa zhes pas tha mi dad pa'i sgra'i don smras so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby the expression of the universal‚Äù states that the meaning of the word is not different.
