original: rdzas kyi rang bzhin ci yin zhes pa la sogs pas de phan tshun brten pa nyid de ston to //
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang bzhin ci yin zhes pa la sogs pas de phan tshun brten pa nyid de ston to //
translated: The phrase what is the nature of the substance? and so on, shows that they are mutually dependent.

original: rdzas kyi rang bzhin ci yin zhes brjod pa na /üîΩrang gi spyi gsal bar byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang bzhin ci yin zhes brjod pa na / rang gi spyi gsal bar byed pa nyid de /
translated: When it is said what is the nature of the substance?

original: ba lang nyid gsal bar byed pa nyid ba lang gi rang bzhin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ba lang nyid gsal bar byed pa nyid ba lang gi rang bzhin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: it should be explained that it is the very manifestation of its universal.

original: spyi'i rang bzhin zhes brjod pa na /üîΩrang gi rdzas kyis mngon bar gsal bar bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: spyi'i rang bzhin zhes brjod pa na / rang gi rdzas kyis mngon bar gsal bar bya ba nyid de /
translated: And when it is said what is the nature of the universal?üîΩit should be explained that it is the very manifestation of its substance.

original: ba lang gi rdzas kyis mngon par gsal bar bya ba ni ba lang nyid do zhes bshad par bya'o zhes pa 'di ltar phan tshun brten pas rang bzhin nges par bstan pa'i phyir phan tshun brten pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lang gi rdzas kyis mngon par gsal bar bya ba ni ba lang nyid do zhes bshad par bya'o zhes pa 'di ltar phan tshun brten pas rang bzhin nges par bstan pa'i phyir phan tshun brten pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because the nature is taught as mutually dependent, there is mutual dependence.

original: gcig la rang bzhin du du ma nyid //
analyzed: gcig la rang bzhin du du ma nyid //
translated: If the nature of one is many,

original: ces ba rdzas dang yod pa nyid la sogs pa'ang rang bzhin du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces ba rdzas dang yod pa nyid la sogs pa'ang rang bzhin du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that substance, existence, and so on would also have many natures.

original: ci las she na gsungs pa /üîΩphan tshun mang po gsal byed phyir //
analyzed: ci las she na gsungs pa / phan tshun mang po gsal byed phyir //
translated: What is the reason? It is stated:üîΩBecause many mutually clarify.

analyzed: yon tan la sogs pas rnam par bcad pa'i rdzas la sogs pa la 'jog pa ste /

analyzed: yul gzhan ma yin pa nyid nye bar 'dren par byed pas ni khyad par gyi sgra ste / rdzas la sogs pas sam /

original: khyad par gyi khyad par gyi sgra ste /
analyzed: khyad par gyi khyad par gyi sgra ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù is used to bring out the fact that they are not other objects.

original: sa las gyur pa'i shing gi shing sha pa'i sgra la sogs pas ci ltar btang snyoms su byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: sa las gyur pa'i shing gi shing sha pa'i sgra la sogs pas ci ltar btang snyoms su byed pa ma yin /
translated: How can one be indifferent to the word ‚Äútree‚Äù when it is applied to a tree that is a substance, or to the word ‚Äú≈õim≈õapƒÅ‚Äù when it is applied to a tree that is a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ?

original: btang snyoms su byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms su byed pa kho na'o //
translated: One must be indifferent to them.

original: don du gnyer ba ni rang gi yul la gnas pas yul med pa'i rang gi don mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba ni rang gi yul la gnas pas yul med pa'i rang gi don mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'dis ni mngon bar 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa'i phyir khyad par gyi sgra ni spyi'i sgra la phan 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni mngon bar 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa'i phyir khyad par gyi sgra ni spyi'i sgra la phan 'dogs pa ste /

analyzed: de @267b las kyang spyi'i sgra de dang mi 'gal lo zhes ston par byed do //
translated: And from that, the word ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù does not contradict it.

original: tshogs pa yang zhes pa la sogs pas mi 'gal ba'i phyir ma spangs pa na yon tan 'phel ba ston par byed do //
analyzed: tshogs pa yang zhes pa la sogs pas mi 'gal ba'i phyir ma spangs pa na yon tan 'phel ba ston par byed do //

analyzed: yang na phan tshun mi spong pa la gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs so //

analyzed: phan tshun gyi don mi spong na ni rang gi don gyi khyad par du byas pa'i don rjod par byed pa nyid du 'thad kyi rnam pa gzhan du na ma yin no //

original: yongs su bor ba ni yongs su bor brjod par byed pa bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis gzhan du yin na ci las shing gi sgra ni shing sha pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams dang gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: yongs su bor ba ni yongs su bor brjod par byed pa bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis gzhan du yin na ci las shing gi sgra ni shing sha pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams dang gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: If the abandonment is different, then what is the meaning of the word tree? The words ≈õim≈õapƒÅ, etc. would have a common basis.

analyzed: de bzhin du yang zhes pa phan tshun gyi don mi spong bar gyur pa kho na'o zhes pa'i don to //

original: gnyid dag gis zhes pa /
analyzed: gnyid dag gis zhes pa /

analyzed: dper na shing la zhes pa lta bu'i rang bzhin dang rkyen dag gi'o //

original: 'dir yang so sor rtog par byed pa ni rang gi don shing gi spyi la 'jug bzhin pa ni las la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba'i don spong bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: 'dir yang so sor rtog par byed pa ni rang gi don shing gi spyi la 'jug bzhin pa ni las la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba'i don spong bar mi byed cing /
translated: Here also, the analysis is as follows: The word ‚Äútree‚Äù is engaged in its own meaning, the universal tree, and does not abandon the meaning of the particulars, such as action.

analyzed: aam zhes pa'i rkyen las kyi spyi la gnas pa yang shing la sogs pa don rtogs par byed pa rnams spong ba ma yin no //
translated: And the word ‚Äúmango,‚Äù which is based on the universal action, does not abandon the particulars, such as tree.

original: de ltar phan tshun gyi don mi spong ba na /
analyzed: de ltar phan tshun gyi don mi spong ba na /
translated: Thus, since they do not mutually exclude each other,

original: de dag gi tshogs pa gang yin pa shing la zhes pa de ni yan lag gi don gyi khyad par du byas pa'i don rjod par byed par 'thad do //
analyzed: de dag gi tshogs pa gang yin pa shing la zhes pa de ni yan lag gi don gyi khyad par du byas pa'i don rjod par byed par 'thad do //

original: de bzhin du autpala sngon po zhes pa'i sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag tshig sdud kyi don rjod par byed pa nyid ni phan tshun gyi don las ma bsal bar gyur pa na sbyor ro zhes sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar ni sngon po'i sgra sngon po'i khyad par autpala ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams mi spong ba ni ;

original: autpala dang autpala ma yin pa la 'jug pa'i don to //
analyzed: autpala dang autpala ma yin pa la 'jug pa'i don to //

analyzed: autpala'i sgra autpala'i khyad par sngon po ma yin pa la sogs pa mi spong ba'i yang sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa la 'jug pa'o //

original: tshogs pa ni cha shas kyi don dag gis khyad par du byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa ni cha shas kyi don dag gis khyad par du byas pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the word collection is distinguished by the meaning of part.

original: de lta na 'o na de dag gi brjod bar bya ba ma yin pa kho na na de ci ltar de dag gi gzhi mthun pa yin /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na de dag gi brjod bar bya ba ma yin pa kho na na de ci ltar de dag gi gzhi mthun pa yin /

analyzed: de ltar ni gang gis brjod par bya ba de tha mi dad pa ste /

analyzed: gang dag tha dad pa de dag de'i brjod bar bya ba ma yin no zhe na /

analyzed: de gzhi gcig par rtogs par byed par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //

original: de ltar de dag gi don rab tu @268a * //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gi don rab tu @268a * //

original: sbyor ba'o zhes de'i don nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: sbyor ba'o zhes de'i don nyid kyi phyir /

original: de ni de dag gi zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi zhes brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: yang na yan lag tha dad pas tha dad par sgro btags nas de dag gi tshogs pa kho na'o zhes tha snyad bstan par bya'o //

original: mang po rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: mang po rnams kyi ste /

analyzed: dper na rgyal po'i skyes bu gzugs mdzes pa can shog ces pa lta bu ste /

original: rang gi don gyi spyi la 'jug bzhin pa'i ngag gi tshig rnams thams cad kyi /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi spyi la 'jug bzhin pa'i ngag gi tshig rnams thams cad kyi /
translated: All the words of speech that engage the general meaning of themselves,

original: cig shos rnams kyi yang ngag gi don rjod par byed pa nyid ma spangs pa na sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: cig shos rnams kyi yang ngag gi don rjod par byed pa nyid ma spangs pa na sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: when the other‚Äôs expression of the meaning of speech is not abandoned, it should be applied.

analyzed: don gzhan gyi rjod bar byed pa sngar kho nar rtogs par byas zin no zhes gsungs pa /

translated: ‚ÄúAs previously explained‚Äù refers to ‚ÄúIt is not only blue, nor only a lotus,‚Äù and so on. The words ‚Äúblue‚Äù and ‚Äúlotus‚Äù indicate that the meaning of the collection is meaningless individually.

original: tshogs pa'i don gzhan mngon par rjod par byed pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i don gzhan mngon par rjod par byed pa nyid du gsungs so //

original: brjod pa yang zhes pa spyi dang khyad par gyi sgra dag mi 'gal ba na spyi'i sgras khyad par rnams mi gtong zhing mi len pa'i dbang du byas nas tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: brjod pa yang zhes pa spyi dang khyad par gyi sgra dag mi 'gal ba na spyi'i sgras khyad par rnams mi gtong zhing mi len pa'i dbang du byas nas tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
translated: ‚ÄúAlso expressed‚Äù means that when the words for the general and the particular are not contradictory, the word for the general does not abandon or take the particulars. With that in mind, a verse is spoken:

analyzed: 'dod pa ni de rnams la the tshom za ba rnam par gcad pa don du gnyer ba'o //

analyzed: tsam gyi sgra ni khyad par gzhan 'dod pa bsal ba'i ched du'o //

analyzed: de ltar ni shing gi sgra las pa la sha la sogs pa'i yul can kho na'i 'dod pa skye'i /

analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i yul can ni ma yin no //

analyzed: de la yang bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'dod par mi 'gyur na 'gyur ba yang ste /

original: de'i phyir dor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dor ba ma yin no //

analyzed: gang zhig gang rnams la 'dod pa'i rgyur yin pa des de rnams dor ba ma yin te /

analyzed: dper na gzhal bya nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnams bzhin /

original: spyi'i sgra yang rang gi khyad par rnams la 'dod pa'i rgyu'o zhes pa khyad byed dang 'gal ba'o //üîΩ'o na nye bar blangs ba ste /
analyzed: spyi'i sgra yang rang gi khyad par rnams la 'dod pa'i rgyu'o zhes pa khyad byed dang 'gal ba'o // 'o na nye bar blangs ba ste /

analyzed: ma btang ba'i phyir ro zhe na gsungs pa /

original: blangs ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: blangs ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is not taken up, etc.

original: blangs pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: blangs pa ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not that it is taken up,

original: rtogs par byas pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to//
analyzed: rtogs par byas pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to//
translated: and it is not that it is realized.

analyzed: @268b gang zhig gang rnams la the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa des de rnams rtogs par byas pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning is that which is the cause of doubt for some, that does not realize them.

original: dpe de kho na bzhin /
analyzed: dpe de kho na bzhin /

original: spyi'i sgra yang rang gi khyad par rnams la the tshom gyi rgyu'o zhes pa rgyu dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: spyi'i sgra yang rang gi khyad par rnams la the tshom gyi rgyu'o zhes pa rgyu dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúgeneral‚Äù is the cause of doubt for its particulars. This is a contradiction with the cause.

original: mtshungs na 'ang de dag don gcig nyid //
analyzed: mtshungs na 'ang de dag don gcig nyid //
translated: Even if they are similar, they are the same thing.

original: ces pa gang du spyi dang khyad par gyi sgra gnyis ka mi spong ba dang mi len pa der don gcig pa nyid de gzhi mthun pa nyid ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa gang du spyi dang khyad par gyi sgra gnyis ka mi spong ba dang mi len pa der don gcig pa nyid de gzhi mthun pa nyid ces pa'i don to //
translated: Where the two words ‚Äúgeneral‚Äù and ‚Äúparticular‚Äù are not rejected and not taken up, there is the same thing, the meaning of ‚Äúcommon locus.‚Äù

original: ji ltar spyi'i sgras rang gi khyad par rnams spong ba ma yin zhing 'dor ba ma yin pa de ltar ci khyad par gyi sgras kyang spyi yin nam zhes pa'i dri ba spong par byed pa gsungs pa /

translated: Just as the word ‚Äúgeneral‚Äù does not reject and does not abandon its particulars, in the same way, is it that the word ‚Äúparticular‚Äù is also a general? The question is answered:

original: du ma yin yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: du ma yin yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Although there are many, etc.

original: gal te yang spyi du ma yin pa de lta yang /
analyzed: gal te yang spyi du ma yin pa de lta yang /
translated: Even though the universal is not many,üîΩthe word takes up its particularities and makes them understood.

analyzed: de'i khyad par sgras len te rtogs par byas so zhes pa'i don to //

original: rtogs par byed pa las tha dad par len pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa las tha dad par len pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to take up something different from what is to be understood.

original: ji ltar shing sha ba'i sgras don gyi shing dang sa las gyur pa dang rdzas su yod pa'i spyi blangs kyi ma dor ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar shing sha ba'i sgras don gyi shing dang sa las gyur pa dang rdzas su yod pa'i spyi blangs kyi ma dor ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the word ‚Äú≈õim≈õapƒÅ‚Äù takes up the meaning, the tree, and the universal that is derived from earth and substantially existent, but not without remainder.

original: ci'i phyir yang khyad par gyi sgras spyi rnams nye bar len zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang khyad par gyi sgras spyi rnams nye bar len zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Why does the word ‚Äúparticular‚Äù take up the universals? It is said:

analyzed: mi 'khrul bas shes pa gang gi phyir bye brag ni spyi la mi 'khrul ba ste /
translated: Because the particular is not mistaken with regard to the universal,

original: spyi med na bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi med na bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without the universal there is no particular.

original: de'i phyir des nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir des nye bar len pa'o //

original: de dag khyad par dang / khyad par gzhi nyid 'dod pa ma yin zhes pa shing ni shing sha pa la sogs la 'khrul pa rnam par gcod pa la ltos so zhes pas khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba'i dngos po yod do //
analyzed: de dag khyad par dang / khyad par gzhi nyid 'dod pa ma yin zhes pa shing ni shing sha pa la sogs la 'khrul pa rnam par gcod pa la ltos so zhes pas khyad par dang khyad par du bya ba'i dngos po yod do //
translated: The statement they are not accepted as the basis of the distinction and the distinguished is in reference to the elimination of error with respect to the tree and the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ. Thus, the distinguished and the basis of the distinction exist.

original: shing sha pa ni shing gi spyi la mi 'khrul zhing ltos pa ma yin no zhes pas med do //
analyzed: shing sha pa ni shing gi spyi la mi 'khrul zhing ltos pa ma yin no zhes pas med do //
translated: The ≈õim≈õapƒÅ is not nonerroneous with respect to the universal tree, and it is not dependent on it. Thus, it does not exist.

original: 'khrul pa can gyi khyad par dag la ni khyad par dang khyad par gyi dngos po mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa can gyi khyad par dag la ni khyad par dang khyad par gyi dngos po mtshungs pa ste /
translated: With respect to erroneous distinctions, there is a sameness of the distinguished and the basis of the distinction.

original: dper na sngon po dang autpala dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon po dang autpala dag bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the case of blue and the lotus.

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi sgra dag phan tshun spong ba bkag pa na /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi sgra dag phan tshun spong ba bkag pa na /
translated: When the words universal and distinction are mutually negated,

original: spyi'i sgra gnyis dag dang khyad par gyi sgra gnyis dag phan tshun gyi don spong ba grub bo zhes pas 'di bsgrub bar bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: spyi'i sgra gnyis dag dang khyad par gyi sgra gnyis dag phan tshun gyi don spong ba grub bo zhes pas 'di bsgrub bar bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: the words universal and distinction are established as mutually excluding each other. Thus, this is not to be established.

original: rgyu ni bsgrub par bya ba'o zhes pa de'i phyir de kho na 'dri ste /
analyzed: rgyu ni bsgrub par bya ba'o zhes pa de'i phyir de kho na 'dri ste /
translated: The reason is to be established. Therefore, that is asked.

original: yang 'di la ci zhig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'di la ci zhig ces pa la sogs pa'o //

original: spyi dag gi rang gi spyi la ltos pas tha dad pa'i phyir logs par nye bar ma blangs so //
analyzed: spyi dag gi rang gi spyi la ltos pas tha dad pa'i phyir logs par nye bar ma blangs so //
translated: Since the universals are differentiated by their dependence on their own universals, they are not taken as different.

original: khyad par khyad par gzhan don can //üîΩzhes pa shing nyid kyi khyad @269a * //
analyzed: khyad par khyad par gzhan don can // zhes pa shing nyid kyi khyad @269a * //
translated: The particular has another particular.üîΩ The particular of tree

analyzed: @270a * // gzhan du na grogs po gcig byas pa kho nas grogs por rtogs pas so // de la yon tan dang las ni shing sha pa'i sgras rdzas kyi sgra sel bar byed bzhin pa la grogs po'i grogs po'i dgra po bzhin du rjes su yi rang bar byed do // yon tan gyi bye brag gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang las kyi khyad bar 'degs pa la sogs pa rnams ni shing sha pa'i sgas grogs po'i dgra bo'i grogs po bzhin du rdzas kyi sgras gzugs la sogs pa dang 'degs pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyi gang
translated: Otherwise, the friend of a friend would be recognized as a friend merely by being a friend of a friend.üîΩThe words ‚Äúquality‚Äù and ‚Äúaction‚Äù are used to exclude the word ‚Äúsubstance,‚Äù just as the words ‚Äúfriend of a friend‚Äù are used to exclude the enemy of a friend.üîΩThe words ‚Äúquality‚Äù and ‚Äúaction‚Äù are used to exclude the words ‚Äúsubstance,‚Äù ‚Äúform,‚Äù etc., and ‚Äúlifting,‚Äù etc., just as the words ‚Äúfriend of a friend‚Äù are used to exclude the friend of the enemy of a friend.

analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gal te yang shing sha pa'i sgra dang shing gi sgra'i don shing nyid yin pa de lta na yang shing sha pa'i sgra la shing sha pa'i don dang ldan ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag yod de /
analyzed: gal te yang shing sha pa'i sgra dang shing gi sgra'i don shing nyid yin pa de lta na yang shing sha pa'i sgra la shing sha pa'i don dang ldan ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag yod de /
translated: Even if the meaning of the word palasha and the word tree is just tree, still the word palasha has a particular characteristic consisting of the possession of the meaning palasha.

original: des na shing gi don nye bar len pa yod na yang pa la sha la sogs pa mi sel bar thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na shing gi don nye bar len pa yod na yang pa la sha la sogs pa mi sel bar thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, even if the meaning of the word tree is appropriated, it is not the case that the word trunk is not eliminated.

original: mi rigs te zhes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: mi rigs te zhes pa la sogs pa /
translated: The meaning of the summary is this: It is not so, etc.

original: ji ltar pha rol bos shing sha pa'i sgra dag ma 'dres pa'i don du brjod pas de ltar 'dir yang 'gyur bar bya dgos so zhes pa bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar pha rol bos shing sha pa'i sgra dag ma 'dres pa'i don du brjod pas de ltar 'dir yang 'gyur bar bya dgos so zhes pa bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: Just as the opponent expresses the meaning of the words tree and trunk as distinct, so too must we do the same here.

original: yang gang pha rol po'i ltar 'gyur bar bya dgos so zhes pa'i nges par 'di ci las sha na /
analyzed: yang gang pha rol po'i ltar 'gyur bar bya dgos so zhes pa'i nges par 'di ci las sha na /
translated: Moreover, why must we do as the opponent does?

original: ci las kyang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ci las kyang ma yin gyi /
translated: We do not do so because of anything else.

original: ji ltar pha rol pos 'jig rten pa'i grags pa rjes su srung bas te /üîΩ'jig rten na spyi dang khyad par gyi sgra dag ma 'dres pa'i don can nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar pha rol pos 'jig rten pa'i grags pa rjes su srung bas te / 'jig rten na spyi dang khyad par gyi sgra dag ma 'dres pa'i don can nyid kyi phyir /
translated: We do so because we follow the opponent in protecting worldly renown.üîΩBecause in the world the words universal and particular have distinct meanings, we also posit the words tree and trunk as having distinct meanings.

original: shing sha pa dang shing gi sgra dag ni don tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa de ltar kho bo cag gis kyang ngo zhes pa 'di tsam zhig brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: shing sha pa dang shing gi sgra dag ni don tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa de ltar kho bo cag gis kyang ngo zhes pa 'di tsam zhig brjod par bya'o //
translated: We merely say this much.

original: gal te de de'i bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te de de'i bya ba ma yin na /
translated: If that is not its object,

original: 'o na ci ltar shing sha pa'i sgra las /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar shing sha pa'i sgra las /
translated: then how is it that from the word ≈õim≈õapƒÅ

original: sel ba shin tu mang por rtogs par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: sel ba shin tu mang por rtogs par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: one understands a great many exclusions?üîΩHe says:

original: don gyis ni 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don gyis ni 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: By the meaning, etc.

original: shing sha pa'i sgras shing sha pa'i don rtogs par byas pa na shing sha pa nyid kyang ngo med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir shugs las shing nyid rtogs te /
analyzed: shing sha pa'i sgras shing sha pa'i don rtogs par byas pa na shing sha pa nyid kyang ngo med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir shugs las shing nyid rtogs te /
translated: When the word ≈õim≈õapƒÅ causes one to understand the meaning of ≈õim≈õapƒÅ, then by the power of the fact that ≈õim≈õapƒÅ does not occur without tree, tree is understood.

original: de'i phyir des don gyis bsal bar bya bzhin pa bum pa la sogs pa ni rmongs pas sgras byas par sems par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir des don gyis bsal bar bya bzhin pa bum pa la sogs pa ni rmongs pas sgras byas par sems par byed do //
translated: Therefore, by that, the object of exclusion, such as a pot, is understood.

original: yang ci ltar rtags nyid du mtshungs ba la /
analyzed: yang ci ltar rtags nyid du mtshungs ba la /
translated: But how is it that, although the signs are the same,

original: du ba la sogs pa ni dngos su me la sogs pa la rdzas nyid la sogs pa rtogs par byed /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa ni dngos su me la sogs pa la rdzas nyid la sogs pa rtogs par byed /
translated: smoke, etc. directly cause one to understand fire, etc. and substantiality, etc.üîΩIt is said:

original: gang gsungs pa rtags las ni gang rjes su 'brel ba can gyi rtags can de rnams kyang rtogs par bya ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: gang gsungs pa rtags las ni gang rjes su 'brel ba can gyi rtags can de rnams kyang rtogs par bya ba'o zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom a sign, that which is related to the sign is also understood.‚Äù

original: shing sha pa'i sgra ni dngos su shing sha ba nyid kho na rtogs bar byed cing spyi @271a * //üîΩgzhan rnams ni shugs las yin no //
analyzed: shing sha pa'i sgra ni dngos su shing sha ba nyid kho na rtogs bar byed cing spyi @271a * // gzhan rnams ni shugs las yin no //
translated: The word ≈õim≈õapƒÅ causes one to understand the tree ≈õim≈õapƒÅ itself, but other things by implication.

original: gzhan yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa la ltos pas sgra rang gi don rtogs pa'i rgyu 'dod cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa la ltos pas sgra rang gi don rtogs pa'i rgyu 'dod cing /
translated: Moreover, you accept that the word is the cause of understanding its object by virtue of its relation, which is defined as invariable concomitance.

original: de ci ltar rdzas su yod pa nyid la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: de ci ltar rdzas su yod pa nyid la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin /
translated: How then can it not cause one to understand the existence of the object?

original: de med na sgra nye bar dmigs pa ma yin pas so zhe na /
analyzed: de med na sgra nye bar dmigs pa ma yin pas so zhe na /
translated: If it did not exist, the word would not be perceived.

original: skyon 'di med de /
analyzed: skyon 'di med de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: de la don gyi 'brel pa ni skyes bus byas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la don gyi 'brel pa ni skyes bus byas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The relation of the word to its object is not created by a person.

original: 'o na kyang rang bzhin las te /
analyzed: 'o na kyang rang bzhin las te /
translated: It is rather natural.

original: de ni gang dang gang rang bzhin gyis med na mi 'byung bar gyur pa de dang de kho na rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de ni gang dang gang rang bzhin gyis med na mi 'byung bar gyur pa de dang de kho na rtogs par byed do //
translated: That is, it causes one to understand only that which is invariably concomitant with it.

original: sgra'i 'brel ba ni skyes bus byas pa'i brdas nye bar 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: sgra'i 'brel ba ni skyes bus byas pa'i brdas nye bar 'ongs pa ste /
translated: The relation of the word to its object is created by the convention of a person.

original: rdzas nyid la sogs pa la shing gi sgra brdar byas pa yang ma yin no /
analyzed: rdzas nyid la sogs pa la shing gi sgra brdar byas pa yang ma yin no /
translated: Nor is the word tree a conventional symbol for substance, etc.

original: de ci las de la ltos pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag yin /
analyzed: de ci las de la ltos pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag yin /
translated: How is it that the word tree is concomitant with and excludes substance, etc.?

original: de'i phyir de ni rdzas la sogs pa rnams kyi rtogs par byed pa bo ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rdzas la sogs pa rnams kyi rtogs par byed pa bo ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, substance, etc. are not the means of understanding the word tree.

original: 'o na sgra'i 'brel pa yang skyes bus ma byas pa kho nar brjod par 'dod pa na ni /
analyzed: 'o na sgra'i 'brel pa yang skyes bus ma byas pa kho nar brjod par 'dod pa na ni /
translated: If you maintain that the relation of the word to its referent is not created by man,

original: de la des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par gzung ba na spyi gzhan rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de la des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par gzung ba na spyi gzhan rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: then when the particular that is produced by that word is apprehended, the universal is held to be the cause of understanding another particular.

original: de khyad par med par gzung ba na ni /
analyzed: de khyad par med par gzung ba na ni /
translated: But when that particular is apprehended without distinction,

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir mi 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir mi 'dod do zhe na /
translated: it is not held to be the cause of understanding another particular, because of error.

original: du ba la sogs pa'i rtag la yang 'di mtshungs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i rtag la yang 'di mtshungs pa kho na ste /
translated: This is exactly the same in the case of smoke, etc.

original: de yang 'bar ba nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i khyad par can du me la sogs pa la rtogs par nus pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: de yang 'bar ba nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i khyad par can du me la sogs pa la rtogs par nus pa ma yin pas so //
translated: For, smoke, etc. are not capable of being understood as the particular of the universal fire, etc.

original: de la sgra kho na la brtsad pa la rjes su chags pa 'di ci yin /
analyzed: de la sgra kho na la brtsad pa la rjes su chags pa 'di ci yin /
translated: What is this attachment to the mere words of the opponent?

original: gal te khyad par ni khyad par gzhan gyi don zhes pa /
analyzed: gal te khyad par ni khyad par gzhan gyi don zhes pa /
translated: If the opponent says that the difference is the object of another difference,

original: yon tan gyi khyad par ni mngar ba dang snum pa nyid la sogs pa rnams so//
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par ni mngar ba dang snum pa nyid la sogs pa rnams so//
translated: the difference of a quality is such things as sweetness and oiliness.

original: de la 'di rnams phan tshun sel na gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur bar bya bar mi rigs na /
analyzed: de la 'di rnams phan tshun sel na gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur bar bya bar mi rigs na /
translated: If these mutually exclude each other, it is not tenable that they share the same basis.

original: de yang yod de /
analyzed: de yang yod de /
translated: But they do exist.

original: de ltar ni tsa ra ka ru ro ni snum pa nyid la sogs pa yon tan gzhan rnams dang gzhi mthun pa nyid du nya bar dmigs so //
analyzed: de ltar ni tsa ra ka ru ro ni snum pa nyid la sogs pa yon tan gzhan rnams dang gzhi mthun pa nyid du nya bar dmigs so //
translated: Thus Caraka sees that oiliness and other qualities share the same basis as sweetness.

original: de ci ltar zhes pa ci ltar yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes sems pa'o //
analyzed: de ci ltar zhes pa ci ltar yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes sems pa'o //
translated: How is that? He thinks that it is not tenable in any way.

original: 'dis ni gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir mngar ba la sogs pa rnams til nag po bzhin du mi sel bar rjes su dpag nas 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du gsal bar byed do /
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir mngar ba la sogs pa rnams til nag po bzhin du mi sel bar rjes su dpag nas 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du gsal bar byed do /
translated: This clearly shows that the reason is inconclusive because sweetness and so on do not mutually exclude each other, like black sesame seeds, and it is inferred that they share the same basis.

original: sel ba med na yang yod pa'i phyir mngar ba dang snum pa dang grang ba nyid la sogs @271b pa la sel ba ni dod zla dang 'gal ba'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: sel ba med na yang yod pa'i phyir mngar ba dang snum pa dang grang ba nyid la sogs @271b pa la sel ba ni dod zla dang 'gal ba'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: If there is no exclusion, then there is existence. Therefore, in terms of sweet, oily, and cold, etc., exclusion is not the cause of the opposite, the contradictory.

original: de yod kyang ma tshang ba na de med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de yod kyang ma tshang ba na de med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Even though it exists, if there is incompleteness, then it does not exist.

original: gzhi mthun pa nyid ni zhes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa nyid ni zhes pa la sogs pa /
translated: The common locus is, etc.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par rnams kyi gzhi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa 'di ni de'i rten dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par rnams kyi gzhi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa 'di ni de'i rten dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: The common locus of the particular qualities is the basis of those. Because it is not contradictory with the support,

original: mngar ba la sogs pa rnams kyi gang rten du gyur ba'i rdzas de dang de rnams mi 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: mngar ba la sogs pa rnams kyi gang rten du gyur ba'i rdzas de dang de rnams mi 'gal ba ste /
translated: the substance that is the support of the sweet, etc., is not contradictory with those.

original: yon tan rnams ni rang gi rten dang 'gal ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan rnams ni rang gi rten dang 'gal ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: The qualities are not contradictory with their own support.

original: rdzas kho na'i yon tan mngar bo'o //
analyzed: rdzas kho na'i yon tan mngar bo'o //
translated: The sweet quality is the quality of substance alone.

original: de kho na'i yon tan grang ba dang snum ba nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams ni ro'i yon tan gyi ma yin te ;
analyzed: de kho na'i yon tan grang ba dang snum ba nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams ni ro'i yon tan gyi ma yin te ;
translated: The qualities of cold, oily, etc., are not the qualities of taste.

original: de'i phyir rdzas de la zhugs pa rnams ro la nye bar gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzas de la zhugs pa rnams ro la nye bar gdags par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who are engaged in substance should impute taste.

original: 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba'o //
analyzed: 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba'o //
translated: The reason for imputation is the convergence of the same object.

original: btags pa'i 'bras bu ni mngar po nyid ni snum pa la sogs pa rnams dang lhan cig spyod pa nyid du 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: btags pa'i 'bras bu ni mngar po nyid ni snum pa la sogs pa rnams dang lhan cig spyod pa nyid du 'chad pa'o //
translated: The result of imputation is the explanation of the co-occurrence of sweetness and so on.

original: de las kyang ji ltar de rnams kyi rten dngos rdzas ni mngar po la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las kyang ji ltar de rnams kyi rten dngos rdzas ni mngar po la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: From that, just as the actual substance that is the basis of those is endowed with the qualities of sweet and so on,

original: mngar po rdzas so //
analyzed: mngar po rdzas so //
translated: it is said that sweet substance,üîΩcold and heavy are also imputed.

original: grang ba'o // lci ba nyid do zhes brjod par bya ba de ltar btags pa'i rten mngar ba zhes bya ba'i ro yang snum pa nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grang ba'o // lci ba nyid do zhes brjod par bya ba de ltar btags pa'i rten mngar ba zhes bya ba'i ro yang snum pa nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that way, the basis of imputation, the taste called sweet, is also endowed with the qualities of oiliness and so on.

original: mngar po ni snum pa'o lci ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mngar po ni snum pa'o lci ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Sweet is oily and heavy should be said.

original: de ltar brtags pa ni 'dir gzhi mthun pa nyid du brtags pa'o zhes brjod par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de ltar brtags pa ni 'dir gzhi mthun pa nyid du brtags pa'o zhes brjod par 'gyur ro /
translated: In that way, the imputation here is imputed as a common basis.

original: brtags pa'i don gyi dbang las dngos por na de'i bdag nyid 'grub ba ma yin no zhes pas ji skad brjod ba'i skyon med do //
analyzed: brtags pa'i don gyi dbang las dngos por na de'i bdag nyid 'grub ba ma yin no zhes pas ji skad brjod ba'i skyon med do //
translated: But in terms of the object of the investigation, it is not established as having that nature. Therefore, the fault stated does not apply.

original: ma mthong phyir na sel ba nyid//
analyzed: ma mthong phyir na sel ba nyid//
translated: Because it is not seen, it is an exclusion.

original: nyid kyi sgra ni nges par 'dzin pa'i don can no //
analyzed: nyid kyi sgra ni nges par 'dzin pa'i don can no //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù means ‚Äúexclusively.‚Äù

original: ma mthong ba nyid kho na'i phyir sel ba ste 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ma mthong ba nyid kho na'i phyir sel ba ste 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is an exclusion because it is not seen, not because it is contradictory.

original: ji ltar byas ba nyid rtag pa rnams la ma mthong ba'i phyir de sel bar byed pa de ltar khyad par gyi sgra khyad bar gzhan rnams la ma mthong pa'i phyir de rnams sel lo //
analyzed: ji ltar byas ba nyid rtag pa rnams la ma mthong ba'i phyir de sel bar byed pa de ltar khyad par gyi sgra khyad bar gzhan rnams la ma mthong pa'i phyir de rnams sel lo //
translated: Just as non-eternality is an exclusion of eternality because it is not seen in eternal things, in the same way, the word ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù is an exclusion of other distinctions because it is not seen in them.

original: ci'i phyir ma mthong zhe na zhes pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma mthong zhe na zhes pa /
translated: Why is it not seen?

original: shing sha pa'i sgra ba la sha la sogs pa la mi mthong ba'i rgyu 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: shing sha pa'i sgra ba la sha la sogs pa la mi mthong ba'i rgyu 'dri ba'o //
translated: This asks the reason why the word ‚Äú≈õim≈õapƒÅ‚Äù is not seen in things like bark.

original: rang bzhin pa'i don la yang zhes pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin pa'i don la yang zhes pa /
translated: Even in the case of an intrinsic object,

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi rang bzhin du 'brel ba nyid kyis na rang bzhin ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi rang bzhin du 'brel ba nyid kyis na rang bzhin ba ste /
translated: it is intrinsic because it is related as the nature of causes and conditions.

original: sgra'i mtshan nyid kyi don to zhes pa @272a * //
analyzed: sgra'i mtshan nyid kyi don to zhes pa @272a * //
translated: The meaning of the definition of sound.

original: 'dir dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning here.

original: shing sha pa la sogs pa'i sgra ni shing sha pa la sogs pa brjod par 'dod pa kho nas rab tu sbyar gyi ba la sha la sogs pa brjod par 'dod pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shing sha pa la sogs pa'i sgra ni shing sha pa la sogs pa brjod par 'dod pa kho nas rab tu sbyar gyi ba la sha la sogs pa brjod par 'dod pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The word ≈õim≈õapƒÅ, etc., is applied only by one who wishes to express the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ, etc., and not by one who wishes to express the ba, ≈õa, etc.

original: de'i phyir shing sha pa brjod bar 'dod pa'i rang bzhin la 'brel ba nyid kyi phyir pa la sha la sogs pa rnams la shing sha pa'i sgra'i sbyor bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shing sha pa brjod bar 'dod pa'i rang bzhin la 'brel ba nyid kyi phyir pa la sha la sogs pa rnams la shing sha pa'i sgra'i sbyor bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the connection with the nature of one who wishes to express the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ, the word ≈õim≈õapƒÅ does not apply to the ba, ≈õa, etc.

original: de las kyang de la ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de las kyang de la ma mthong ba ste /
translated: And even from that, it is not seen there.

original: des na rang bzhin pa'i don 'di la de ma mthong ba khyad bar gzhan sel bar nus pa dor nas /
analyzed: des na rang bzhin pa'i don 'di la de ma mthong ba khyad bar gzhan sel bar nus pa dor nas /
translated: Therefore, in this case of the natural meaning, having abandoned the other exclusion that is not seen,

original: gang 'gal ba nyid spong ba'i rgyur brjod pa de ni rigs ba las 'das nas bdag mtshar bar sems pa'i skyes bu nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang 'gal ba nyid spong ba'i rgyur brjod pa de ni rigs ba las 'das nas bdag mtshar bar sems pa'i skyes bu nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: that which is stated as the cause for the abandonment of contradiction, that is a person who, having gone beyond reasoning, thinks himself clever. This is the meaning.

original: 'gal ba nyid ni nye bar mtshon ba tsam ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid ni nye bar mtshon ba tsam ste /
translated: Contradiction is merely an illustration.

original: gang de'i lhag pa'i rgyu gzhan bshad pa de yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang de'i lhag pa'i rgyu gzhan bshad pa de yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The other causes of that should also be understood as explained.

original: ae ma bdag ces sems pa gang yin pa de ni bdag mtshar ba can gyi skyes bu ste /
analyzed: ae ma bdag ces sems pa gang yin pa de ni bdag mtshar ba can gyi skyes bu ste /
translated: Amazing! That which is thought of as I is the person who thinks of himself as amazing.

original: de'i dngos po ni bdag mtshar bar sems pa'i skyes bu nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni bdag mtshar bar sems pa'i skyes bu nyid do //
translated: His state is the person who thinks of himself as amazing.

original: de yang mngon pa'i nga rgyal nyid do //
analyzed: de yang mngon pa'i nga rgyal nyid do //
translated: That is also pride.

original: de ni bdag mtshar bar sems pa'i skyes bu'i sgra'i rab tu sbyor ba la'o //
analyzed: de ni bdag mtshar bar sems pa'i skyes bu'i sgra'i rab tu sbyor ba la'o //
translated: That is the application of the term person who thinks of himself as amazing.

original: yang gang gis bdag mtshar bar sems pa'i skyes bu'i rtogs pa'o zhes pa 'di ltar brjod pa 'di la mi rigs pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang gang gis bdag mtshar bar sems pa'i skyes bu'i rtogs pa'o zhes pa 'di ltar brjod pa 'di la mi rigs pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is unreasonable about this statement: By what is the person who thinks of himself as amazing realized?

original: khyad par gyi don can gyi sgra rnams ni spyi'i don 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir rgyal po'i bu bzhin du phan tshun 'gal ba rnams so zhes pa 'di kho na re zhig mi rigs te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi don can gyi sgra rnams ni spyi'i don 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir rgyal po'i bu bzhin du phan tshun 'gal ba rnams so zhes pa 'di kho na re zhig mi rigs te /
translated: Because terms that have a specific meaning take away the general meaning, they are mutually contradictory, like the son of a barren woman.

original: de ltar ni spyi'i don 'phrog par byed pa nyid ni 'gal ba gtan tshigs su nye bar blangs shing /
analyzed: de ltar ni spyi'i don 'phrog par byed pa nyid ni 'gal ba gtan tshigs su nye bar blangs shing /
translated: Thus, in general, the property of the position is stated as the reason, and that is the property of the subject.

original: de yang sgra rnams kyi khyad par gyi yul la spyi'i don rtogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: de yang sgra rnams kyi khyad par gyi yul la spyi'i don rtogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: Moreover, the object of the distinction of words has the characteristic of realizing the general meaning.

original: rgyal po'i bu rnams ni de dang rigs mi mthun pa rgyal srid rang gir byed pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu rnams ni de dang rigs mi mthun pa rgyal srid rang gir byed pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: The sons of the king have the characteristic of taking possession of the kingdom, which is not of the same type as that.

original: gang yod na rang nyid rnam bar rgyal ba ni spyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams la rang dbang du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang yod na rang nyid rnam bar rgyal ba ni spyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams la rang dbang du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: When that exists, the self is victorious, which is to say, one becomes independent with regard to the activities of generosity and so on.

original: de la gal te sgra la son pa'i spyi'i don len par byed pa nyid gtan tshigs nyid du nye bar len na ni dpe gtan tshigs dang bral bar 'gyur zhing ci ste rgyal po'i bul son pa yin na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la gal te sgra la son pa'i spyi'i don len par byed pa nyid gtan tshigs nyid du nye bar len na ni dpe gtan tshigs dang bral bar 'gyur zhing ci ste rgyal po'i bul son pa yin na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: If the mere fact of taking possession of the general meaning that is contained in the word is taken as the reason, then the example would be devoid of the reason. But if it is the son of the king who takes possession, then the reason is not established.

original: de la sgra tsam zhig tha mi dad pa yin gyi don cung zad kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de la sgra tsam zhig tha mi dad pa yin gyi don cung zad kyang ma yin no //
translated: In this regard, it is mere sound that is not different, and not the slightest meaning.

original: de @272b las don grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de @272b las don grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that the meaning is established from that.

original: dngos po la mi ltos pa'i sgra tsam ni 'dod pa tsam las 'byung ba ste yod pa ma yin pas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po la mi ltos pa'i sgra tsam ni 'dod pa tsam las 'byung ba ste yod pa ma yin pas zhes pa'o //
translated: Because mere words that do not depend on things do not exist except as mere wishes.

original: rtogs bar bya ba'i dngos po ni dngos pos 'grub ste /
analyzed: rtogs bar bya ba'i dngos po ni dngos pos 'grub ste /
translated: The thing to be understood is established by a thing.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: tha dad dngos la rab grub pa //
analyzed: tha dad dngos la rab grub pa //
translated: The different things are well established.

original: sgra mtshungs tha dad med pa las /
analyzed: sgra mtshungs tha dad med pa las /
translated: From the same word, there is no difference.

original: rjes dpog rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: rjes dpog rigs pa ma yin te //
translated: Inference is not reasonable.

original: skya bo'i rdzas la me bzhin no //
analyzed: skya bo'i rdzas la me bzhin no //
translated: Like the substance of grayness is not fire.

original: rigs gzhan las ni rab grub pa //
analyzed: rigs gzhan las ni rab grub pa //
translated: Well established from another type,

original: sgra yi spyi ni mthong ba las //
analyzed: sgra yi spyi ni mthong ba las //
translated: From seeing the general of the word,

original: sgrub byed mi rigs dag la sogs //
analyzed: sgrub byed mi rigs dag la sogs //
translated: The proof is unreasonable for the pure and so on.

original: go nyid phyir na rva can bzhin //
analyzed: go nyid phyir na rva can bzhin //
translated: Because of the understanding, like the one with horns.

original: zhes so // khyad par gyi sgra 'ba' zhig bas ni spyi'i don khyad par byas pa'i yul la rtogs par bya ba yang ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // khyad par gyi sgra 'ba' zhig bas ni spyi'i don khyad par byas pa'i yul la rtogs par bya ba yang ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But the object qualified by the general meaning is not understood from the word of the qualifier alone. What then?

original: spyi'i sgra dang lhan cig pa ste /
analyzed: spyi'i sgra dang lhan cig pa ste /
translated: It is together with the word of the general.

original: de las kyang gnyis ka dag ni 'dus bas khyad par gyi sgra spyi'i don len bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las kyang gnyis ka dag ni 'dus bas khyad par gyi sgra spyi'i don len bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, both are included in the word ‚Äúparticular,‚Äù because the word ‚Äúgeneral‚Äù is used to indicate the general meaning.

original: gal te de las khyad par zhan gyi sgra dang 'gal ba yin ba spyi'i sgra yang 'gyur ba yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de las khyad par zhan gyi sgra dang 'gal ba yin ba spyi'i sgra yang 'gyur ba yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If it is argued that the word ‚Äúparticular‚Äù is contradictory to the word ‚Äúgeneral,‚Äù it is not so, because

original: de'i phyir 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: the word ‚Äúgeneral‚Äù is not used. Therefore this is unreasonable.üîΩAlso, it is said:

original: gang yang / de rnams dngos su de sel min //
analyzed: gang yang / de rnams dngos su de sel min //
translated: They do not directly exclude that,üîΩbecause they are not universals.üîΩIf they directly exclude, then the word ‚Äútree‚Äù would be no different from the word ‚Äúblack.‚Äù

original: spyi dang mtshungs nyid ma gyur cig / gal te dngos su sel na ni shing gi sgra nag khyad bar med par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs ba brjod pa de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa kho ba ste /
analyzed: spyi dang mtshungs nyid ma gyur cig / gal te dngos su sel na ni shing gi sgra nag khyad bar med par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs ba brjod pa de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa kho ba ste /
translated: This is not correct, because we say that

original: gang la sgra brdar byas pa de kho na brjod cing /
analyzed: gang la sgra brdar byas pa de kho na brjod cing /
translated: only that which is signified by a word is expressed.

original: shing sha pa'i sgra yang shing sha pa kho na la brdar byas kyi shing spyi la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shing sha pa'i sgra yang shing sha pa kho na la brdar byas kyi shing spyi la ni ma yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äú≈õim≈õapƒÅ‚Äù is signified only by the word ‚Äú≈õim≈õapƒÅ,‚Äù not by the word ‚Äútree.‚Äù

original: des na gal te yang bum pa la sogs pa rnams des dngos su sel ba de lta na yang shing nyid nye bar len pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gal te yang bum pa la sogs pa rnams des dngos su sel ba de lta na yang shing nyid nye bar len pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even if a pot, etc. is directly excluded by that, still, tree-ness is not its appropriated.

original: gang yang 'di ni don gyis nyung du dang shin tu mang po sel par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di yang rigs pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang yang 'di ni don gyis nyung du dang shin tu mang po sel par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di yang rigs pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: And it is not right that this is the exclusion of a few things and a great many things by implication,

original: khyad par ni gnyis ka la son pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rang gi don yang khyad bar gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par ni gnyis ka la son pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rang gi don yang khyad bar gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the difference is in both, and because its own meaning is the nature of the difference.

original: gang yang rung ba'i khyad par gyis brjod pa la yang gnyis ka la son pa'i khyad par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i khyad par gyis brjod pa la yang gnyis ka la son pa'i khyad par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: And when it is expressed by any difference, the difference in both is understood.

original: dper na lhas byin ni mchod sbyin byin gyi sbun drung ngo zhes brjod pan mchod sbyin byin gyi yang spun drung nyid yin pa bzhin no / gang lhas byin mchod sbyin byin gyi spun drung du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dper na lhas byin ni mchod sbyin byin gyi sbun drung ngo zhes brjod pan mchod sbyin byin gyi yang spun drung nyid yin pa bzhin no / gang lhas byin mchod sbyin byin gyi spun drung du 'gyur gyi /
translated: For example, when it is said, ‚ÄúDevadatta is the cousin of Yaj√±adatta,‚Äù Yaj√±adatta is also a cousin.

original: mchod sbyin byin ni ma yin no zhes brjod ba 'di ni srid pa yod pa ma yin pas so //üîΩji ltar yang shing @273a * //
analyzed: mchod sbyin byin ni ma yin no zhes brjod ba 'di ni srid pa yod pa ma yin pas so // ji ltar yang shing @273a * //
translated: This is because it is impossible.üîΩJust as a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ is different from a palƒÅ≈õa, etc.,

original: sha pa ni pa la sha la sogs pa las tha dad pa de ltar bum pa la sogs pa las kyang ste /
analyzed: sha pa ni pa la sha la sogs pa las tha dad pa de ltar bum pa la sogs pa las kyang ste /
translated: so it is also different from a pot, etc.

original: de las kyang shing sha pa brjod pa na ji ltar pa la sha la sogs pa gsal ba rtogs pa de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa bsal ba yang ste /
analyzed: de las kyang shing sha pa brjod pa na ji ltar pa la sha la sogs pa gsal ba rtogs pa de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa bsal ba yang ste /
translated: And just as when a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ is stated, a palƒÅ≈õa, etc., is understood as excluded, so also a pot, etc., is understood as excluded.

original: de'i phyir spyi las pa la sha la sogs pa rnams ni de'i dngos su gsal bar bya ba dang bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyi don gyis so zhes pas rnam bar dbye ba 'di thob pa yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi las pa la sha la sogs pa rnams ni de'i dngos su gsal bar bya ba dang bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyi don gyis so zhes pas rnam bar dbye ba 'di thob pa yin /
translated: Therefore, this distinction is obtained: from the universal, palƒÅ≈õa, etc., are explicitly stated, and pots, etc., are implicitly stated.

original: yang ci'i phyir slob dpon gyis bdag nyid mtshar bar sems pa'i skyes bu'i 'jug pa dang / de dor nas rigs pa kho ba dgod par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir slob dpon gyis bdag nyid mtshar bar sems pa'i skyes bu'i 'jug pa dang / de dor nas rigs pa kho ba dgod par mdzad ce na /
translated: Why did the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna, having rejected the engagement of a person who thinks himself clever, set forth this reasoning?

original: rigs pa dang bral ba mang po rjod par byed pa rnams kyis kyang dngos po'i de kho na nyid rnam par gzhag par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa dang bral ba mang po rjod par byed pa rnams kyis kyang dngos po'i de kho na nyid rnam par gzhag par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, many who are devoid of reasoning are capable of positing the thatness of things.

original: de'i phyir rigs pa las dgongs nas bdag nyid mtshar bar sems pa'i skyes bu'i 'jug pas gang rnams dngos po'i de kho na nyid rtogs par bya ba 'dod pa de rnams kyis de dor nas rigs pa kho na'i rjes su 'brang bar bya'o zhes bsal bar bya ba'i
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs pa las dgongs nas bdag nyid mtshar bar sems pa'i skyes bu'i 'jug pas gang rnams dngos po'i de kho na nyid rtogs par bya ba 'dod pa de rnams kyis de dor nas rigs pa kho na'i rjes su 'brang bar bya'o zhes bsal bar bya ba'i
translated: Therefore, those who, having reflected on reasoning, wish to realize the thatness of things by the engagement of a person who is self-possessed, should abandon those and follow only reasoning.üîΩThis is the point of the passage.

original: don du'o // 'o na de lta na zhes pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: don du'o // 'o na de lta na zhes pa la sogs pas /
translated: Now, if you say, ‚ÄúIn that case . . . ,‚Äù he says:

original: spyi'i sgra ni khyad par rnams la ma mthong ba yod na yang sel ba med pa'i phyir sel ba ni de'i rgyu can ma yin pa nyid du smras so //üîΩma yin gzhan ldan mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: spyi'i sgra ni khyad par rnams la ma mthong ba yod na yang sel ba med pa'i phyir sel ba ni de'i rgyu can ma yin pa nyid du smras so // ma yin gzhan ldan mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: Since the term ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù is not seen to be absent in the particulars, exclusion is not its cause.

original: zhes pas ma grub pa nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pas ma grub pa nyid gsungs so //
translated: He says that it is not established:üîΩBecause the other is seen to possess it.

original: don dang skabs la sogs pa rnams kyis mthong zhes pa'i sogs pa'i sgras yang dag par 'grogs pa la sogs pa rnams gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: don dang skabs la sogs pa rnams kyis mthong zhes pa'i sogs pa'i sgras yang dag par 'grogs pa la sogs pa rnams gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúseen and so on‚Äù should be understood to include ‚Äúaccompanied by‚Äù and so on.

original: de la don gyi shugs kyis spyi'i sgra ni khyad par rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: de la don gyi shugs kyis spyi'i sgra ni khyad par rtogs par byed de /
translated: In this regard, a general term can indicate a particular by the force of the meaning.

original: dper na gzugs mdzes pa'i ched du gzhon nu ma sbyin par bya'o zhes pa lta bu ste /üîΩtshig med kyang gzugs mdzes pa can gyi ched kho nar gzhon nu ma sbyin pa grub ba kho ba ste /
analyzed: dper na gzugs mdzes pa'i ched du gzhon nu ma sbyin par bya'o zhes pa lta bu ste / tshig med kyang gzugs mdzes pa can gyi ched kho nar gzhon nu ma sbyin pa grub ba kho ba ste /
translated: For example, in the statement ‚ÄúA maiden is given for the sake of beauty,‚ÄùüîΩeven though the word ‚Äúbeauty‚Äù is not expressed, it is understood by implication from the statement.

original: tshig brjod pa'i shugs las shin tu gzugs mdzes ba'i ched du zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig brjod pa'i shugs las shin tu gzugs mdzes ba'i ched du zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The particular is understood by the force of the statement.

original: skabs kyi ni ba lang rdzi za ma za ba'i skabs su sen dha wa 'on cig ces brjod pa na lan tshva kho na la rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skabs kyi ni ba lang rdzi za ma za ba'i skabs su sen dha wa 'on cig ces brjod pa na lan tshva kho na la rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the context of a cowherd eating his meal, when someone says, ‚ÄúBring some sand,‚Äù he understands that ‚Äúsalt‚Äù is meant.

original: yang dag par 'grogs pas ni be'u dang bcas pa'i bzhon ma 'on cig ces brjod pa na /
analyzed: yang dag par 'grogs pas ni be'u dang bcas pa'i bzhon ma 'on cig ces brjod pa na /
translated: In the context of ‚ÄúBring the cow together with the calf,‚Äù

original: ba lang @273b bzhon ma kho na rtogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba lang @273b bzhon ma kho na rtogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the cognition of a cow-vehicle alone.

original: de ltar de snang the tshom yin //
analyzed: de ltar de snang the tshom yin //
translated: Thus, that appearance is doubt.

original: zhes ba spyi'i sgra khyad par rnams la mthong ba la gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes ba spyi'i sgra khyad par rnams la mthong ba la gtan tshigs gzhan gsungs so //
translated: The other reason for seeing the general term in the particulars is stated.

original: nag po'i mngar ba la sogs pa rnams la sngar mthong ba po'i de'i rnam pa can gyi the tshom gyi rgyu nyid la yin no //üîΩ'dis ni gang zhig rang gi khyad par gyi rnam pa can gyi the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa de ni rang gi khyad par rnams la sngar mthong ba can yin te /
analyzed: nag po'i mngar ba la sogs pa rnams la sngar mthong ba po'i de'i rnam pa can gyi the tshom gyi rgyu nyid la yin no // 'dis ni gang zhig rang gi khyad par gyi rnam pa can gyi the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa de ni rang gi khyad par rnams la sngar mthong ba can yin te /
translated: In the case of black, sweet, etc., it is the cause of doubt that has the form of what was seen before.

original: 'greng ba nyid bzhin spyi'i sgra yang de lta bu'i zhes rang bzhin gsungs so //
analyzed: 'greng ba nyid bzhin spyi'i sgra yang de lta bu'i zhes rang bzhin gsungs so //
translated: This states the nature of the reason: that which is the cause of doubt having the form of its particulars is that which has seen the particulars before, like standing itself. The general term is also like that.

original: 'o na mnyan par bya ba nyid kyis ma nges pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na mnyan par bya ba nyid kyis ma nges pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn't it indeterminate because it is audible?

original: de ni gang du yang ma mthong ba ste ;
analyzed: de ni gang du yang ma mthong ba ste ;
translated: It is not seen anywhere,

original: the tshom gyi rgyu yang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom gyi rgyu yang ngo zhe na /
translated: and it is not the cause of doubt.

original: 'di yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir rang gi khyad par ni mnyam par bya ba'i bye brag gi bdag nyid rnams kho na ste /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir rang gi khyad par ni mnyam par bya ba'i bye brag gi bdag nyid rnams kho na ste /
translated: Because it is heard, the particulars of the universal are only those that have the nature of the particulars of the object to be cognized.

original: de la yang de mthong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de la yang de mthong ba kho na'o //
translated: And there, too, it is only seen.

original: gang rnams la ma mthong brtags pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams ni de'i khyad par ma yin no zhes pas 'di brtsad par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang rnams la ma mthong brtags pa la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams ni de'i khyad par ma yin no zhes pas 'di brtsad par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But the meanings of the words ‚Äúnot seen,‚Äù ‚Äúimagined,‚Äù and so on are not its particulars. Therefore, this is not to be disputed.

original: spyi nyid yod na zhes pa'i khyad par 'dir yang na blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: spyi nyid yod na zhes pa'i khyad par 'dir yang na blta bar bya ste /
translated: And in this case, too, the qualification ‚Äúif the universal itself exists‚Äù should be supplied.

original: de yang spyi'i sgra'i dbang du byas pa las 'thob bo //
analyzed: de yang spyi'i sgra'i dbang du byas pa las 'thob bo //
translated: And that is obtained from the word ‚Äúuniversal.‚Äù

original: the tshom mi rigs phyir zhe na //
analyzed: the tshom mi rigs phyir zhe na //
translated: If you say that it is not reasonable to doubt,

original: zhes pa ga lte don dang skabs la sogs pa dang bcas par gyur na /
analyzed: zhes pa ga lte don dang skabs la sogs pa dang bcas par gyur na /
translated: if it is associated with the object, the context, and so on,

original: the tshom gyi rgyur mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: the tshom gyi rgyur mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it will not be a cause of doubt,

original: bya rog gnas pa dang bcas pa'i 'greng ba bzhin na /
analyzed: bya rog gnas pa dang bcas pa'i 'greng ba bzhin na /
translated: just as a crow standing on a tree is not.

original: the tshom yang yod de /
analyzed: the tshom yang yod de /
translated: But doubt does exist.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar rang gi khyad par rnams la nye bar dmigs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar rang gi khyad par rnams la nye bar dmigs pa /
translated: Therefore, just as the particulars of the universal are perceived,

original: sngon ma can nyid de ltar don la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa nyid med kyang ngo zhes pas gtan tshigs 'gal ba'o zhes sems so //
analyzed: sngon ma can nyid de ltar don la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa nyid med kyang ngo zhes pas gtan tshigs 'gal ba'o zhes sems so //
translated: The opponent thinks, The reason is contradictory, because although the prior state does not exist simultaneously with the object, and so on, it is said to exist.üîΩThe reason is not contradictory, because the doubt is

original: nges la 'ba' zhig las de yin //
analyzed: nges la 'ba' zhig las de yin //
translated: only about the bare thing.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The opponent says,

original: khyad par dang lhan cig pa las the tshom du brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /üîΩdon dang skabs la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i spyi'i sgra las shing sha pa la sogs pa khyad par nges pa la dus phyis 'ba' zhig pa las khyad par rnams la the tshom yin no //üîΩ'dis ni don la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa nye bar dmigs pa'i dus na the tshom gyi rgyu nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par dang lhan cig pa las the tshom du brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi / 'o na ci zhe na / don dang skabs la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i spyi'i sgra las shing sha pa la sogs pa khyad par nges pa la dus phyis 'ba' zhig pa las khyad par rnams la the tshom yin no // 'dis ni don la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa nye bar dmigs pa'i dus na the tshom gyi rgyu nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: The doubt is not expressed about the bare thing alone, but about the bare thing together with the particular.üîΩIf that is so, then the doubt is about the particulars, because the general term together with the object, the context, and so on, is applied to the particulars, such as the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree, and so on, and later the bare thing alone is applied to the particulars.üîΩThis is because the cause of doubt is not established when the object, and so on, together with the bare thing is observed.

original: gang gi tshe yang the tshom gyi rgyu nyid yin pa de'i tshe don la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa nyid du dam @274a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang the tshom gyi rgyu nyid yin pa de'i tshe don la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa nyid du dam @274a * //
translated: When it is the cause of doubt, then the bare thing is not together with the object, and so on.

original: bcas pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid med do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: bcas pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid med do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction.

original: khyad par la 'ba' zhig med ce na zhes pa 'ba' zhig pa ni khyad par rnams la sbyor ba nyid med de /
analyzed: khyad par la 'ba' zhig med ce na zhes pa 'ba' zhig pa ni khyad par rnams la sbyor ba nyid med de /
translated: If you say that there is no mere qualifier, the word mere is not connected to the qualifiers.

analyzed: de rjod par mi byed pa nyid kyi phyir sgra gzhan bzhin no //

original: ma sbyar ba yang the tshom gyi rgyu nyid du 'thad pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ma sbyar ba yang the tshom gyi rgyu nyid du 'thad pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar na yang rang gi khyad par gyi rnam pa can gyi the tshom gyi rgyu nyid ma grub po // nyan la ltos nas mthong ba yin //

original: zhes pa lan no //
analyzed: zhes pa lan no //
translated: The answer is:üîΩIt is seen in dependence on the hearer.

original: yang na ma gyi tshe nya na ba pho la ltos pas sbyor ba yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang na ma gyi tshe nya na ba pho la ltos pas sbyor ba yin zhe na gsungs pa /

original: gang gi tshe ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /

original: gang gi tshe nyan pa pos shing gi rang bzhin la the tshom za bas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyan pa pos shing gi rang bzhin la the tshom za bas /

analyzed: sa las gyur pa nyid la sogs pa spyi rnams kyi gang yang rung ba'i rang bzhin rtogs pa'i don du /

analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i spyi bsal bas don du gnyer bar 'gyur pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: 'o na nges pa la zhes pa la sogs pas the tshom ma'i 'thad par ston to //

analyzed: de ltar 'dri ba pos shing nges pa la ci zhig las spyi'i sgra 'ba' zhig las the tshom yin /

analyzed: de kho na gtan tshigs ma grub ba nyid do //
translated: That is just an unestablished reason.

analyzed: de'i nges pa la gzhan gyi zhes pa /

analyzed: bden te 'dri ba pos shing nges pa kho na la /
translated: it is true that the questioner has ascertained the tree alone.

original: gang gzhan skabs de mi shes shing //
analyzed: gang gzhan skabs de mi shes shing //

analyzed: sa las gyur pa'i sgra 'ba' zhig thos par gyur pa de'i the tshom skye ste /

analyzed: blo la yod pa /

analyzed: du ma las der the tshom la'o zhes pa /

original: ci 'di sha @275a * //
analyzed: ci 'di sha @275a * //

original: 'thul  @275b pa nyid ni yod ma yin //

original: rang gi don med na med pa'i phyir ro //

original: sgo ni thabs so //

analyzed: rtags de dang mtshungs pa kho na la 'jug pa dang / de dang mi mtshungs pa la mi 'jug pa kho na'o zhes pa 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: That the sign occurs only in what is similar to it and does not occur at all in what is dissimilar to it is the nature of pervasion and counter-pervasion.

original: de la de dang mtshungs pa la ni gdon mi za bar ma yin zhes pa /
analyzed: de la de dang mtshungs pa la ni gdon mi za bar ma yin zhes pa /
translated: Regarding that, ‚Äúit is not necessarily so in what is similar to it‚Äù

original: nges pa 'di ni rigs mthun pa thams cad la 'jug par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa 'di ni rigs mthun pa thams cad la 'jug par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: means that this certainty should not be expressed as occurring in all similar instances.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgsungs pa / 'ga' zhig la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gsungs pa / 'ga' zhig la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said:

original: shing la sogs pa'i sgra ni shing la sogs pa thams cad la mthong ba srid pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa'i sgra ni shing la sogs pa thams cad la mthong ba srid pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe word ‚Äòsome‚Äô is used because the word ‚Äòtree‚Äô is not seen in all trees.

original: de rnams mtha' yas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩ'dod rgyal ba'i sgra rnams ni thams cad du mthong ba srid de /
analyzed: de rnams mtha' yas pa nyid kyi phyir ro // 'dod rgyal ba'i sgra rnams ni thams cad du mthong ba srid de /
translated: Because they are limitless.üîΩThe word ‚Äòsome‚Äô is used because the word ‚Äòdesire‚Äô is seen in all desires.

original: de'i yul gcig nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa ste de'i phyir 'ga' zhig tu zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: de'i yul gcig nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa ste de'i phyir 'ga' zhig tu zhes gsungs so ;
translated: Because its object is one.‚Äù

original: / de ltar re zhig rjes su 'gro ba bshad pa sla ba'o //
analyzed: / de ltar re zhig rjes su 'gro ba bshad pa sla ba'o //
translated: Thus, the pervasion is easy to understand.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod de dang mi mtshungs pa rnams mtha' yas pa nyid kyi phyir ldog pa bshad pa yang thams cad du mi srid pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod de dang mi mtshungs pa rnams mtha' yas pa nyid kyi phyir ldog pa bshad pa yang thams cad du mi srid pa'o zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúThat may be so, but because the dissimilar instances are limitless, the counter-pervasion is impossible.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: mi mtshungs pa la ni mtha' yas pa nyid yod na yang zhes pa gang la sgra'i don med pa de rnams mtha' yas pa nyid yod na 'ang rang gi don med na sgra med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ldog pa bstan par nus te /
analyzed: mi mtshungs pa la ni mtha' yas pa nyid yod na yang zhes pa gang la sgra'i don med pa de rnams mtha' yas pa nyid yod na 'ang rang gi don med na sgra med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ldog pa bstan par nus te /
translated: If there is no meaning of the word in the dissimilar, then even if there is infinity, one can indicate the exclusion that has the characteristic of the absence of the word when its meaning is absent.

original: ma mthong ba ni med pa tsam nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni med pa tsam nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the non-seeing is just the absence.

original: sgra dang don dag 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos por grub pa la rgyu don med pa na /
analyzed: sgra dang don dag 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos por grub pa la rgyu don med pa na /
translated: When the word and the meaning are established as the effect and the cause, when the meaning as the cause is absent,

original: de'i 'bras bu sgra med par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di tsam gyis ma mthong ba rtogs par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu sgra med par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di tsam gyis ma mthong ba rtogs par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the effect, the word, is absent. Just by this much, the non-seeing is understood.

original: de la rten mthong ba mi dgos te /
analyzed: de la rten mthong ba mi dgos te /
translated: In that case, it is not necessary to see the basis,

original: de med kyang ldog par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang ldog par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if it is absent, the exclusion is ascertained.

original: rgyu med na 'bras bu srid pa ma yin pas te /
analyzed: rgyu med na 'bras bu srid pa ma yin pas te /
translated: When the cause is absent, the effect is not possible.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa yang bshad pa sla ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa yang bshad pa sla ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the exclusion is easily explained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes pa @276a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes pa @276a * //
translated: For that very reason,

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba ni de dang mtshungs pa thams cad la mi srid cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba ni de dang mtshungs pa thams cad la mi srid cing /
translated: Because it is impossible that what is seen is similar to all,üîΩand it is possible that what is not seen is dissimilar to all.

original: de dang mtshungs pa ma yin pa la ni ma mthong ba srid pa de'i phyir rang dang 'brel pa can rnams las te rigs mthun pa rnams las gzhan la ste /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa ma yin pa la ni ma mthong ba srid pa de'i phyir rang dang 'brel pa can rnams las te rigs mthun pa rnams las gzhan la ste /
translated: Therefore, it is an inference that excludes other objects that are related to it, that is, objects of the same type,

original: mi mthun phyogs la ma mthong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs la ma mthong pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not seen in objects of a different type.

original: de rnam par gcod pa rjes su dpag pa'o zhes pa /
analyzed: de rnam par gcod pa rjes su dpag pa'o zhes pa /
translated: This is an inference that excludes other objects.

original: gang du rang gi don med pa la ma mthong ba de ni rnam par gcod pa rnams rjes su dpog pa ni rjes su dpag par rang gi don la mngon par brjod do zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gang du rang gi don med pa la ma mthong ba de ni rnam par gcod pa rnams rjes su dpog pa ni rjes su dpag par rang gi don la mngon par brjod do zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: Where there is no object of one‚Äôs own, if it is not seen, it is an inference that excludes other objects. It should be explained that it is an inference that expresses its own object.

original: 'dis ni gal te yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gnyis ka dag kyang rjes su dpog pa la yan lag nyid yin pa de lta na yang ldog pa gtso bo nyid kyi phyir de'i sgo kho nas go bar byed pa nyid do zhes ston to
analyzed: 'dis ni gal te yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gnyis ka dag kyang rjes su dpog pa la yan lag nyid yin pa de lta na yang ldog pa gtso bo nyid kyi phyir de'i sgo kho nas go bar byed pa nyid do zhes ston to
translated: This shows that even though both positive and negative concomitance are components of inference, because negative concomitance is primary, it is understood by means of that alone.

original: / rjes su 'gro pa'i sgo yis ni //
analyzed: / rjes su 'gro pa'i sgo yis ni //
translated: By the door of concomitance,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: ni'i sgra ni nges par 'dzin pa'i don can no //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nges par 'dzin pa'i don can no //
translated: The word ‚Äúni‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúcertainty.‚Äù

original: gal te rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo kho nas mngon bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo kho nas mngon bar 'dod na /
translated: If one desires to ascertain by the door of concomitance alone,

original: de ltar gyur na shing gi sgra don la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa ni shing sha pa la sogs pa rnams la rjes su 'gro ba yod do zhes pas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na shing gi sgra don la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa ni shing sha pa la sogs pa rnams la rjes su 'gro ba yod do zhes pas /
translated: then in that case, the word ‚Äútree‚Äù is concomitant with the meaning of ‚Äú≈õim≈õapƒÅ‚Äù and so on,

original: shing gi sgra 'ba' zhig pa las dngos po gcig la shing sha pa la sogs par snang bar the tshom du mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: shing gi sgra 'ba' zhig pa las dngos po gcig la shing sha pa la sogs par snang bar the tshom du mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: so that from the word ‚Äútree‚Äù alone, there would be no doubt about the appearance of a single entity as ‚Äú≈õim≈õapƒÅ‚Äù and so on.

original: 'on kyang nges pa kho nar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: 'on kyang nges pa kho nar 'gyur ro ;
translated: Rather, there would be certainty.

original: / ci ste du ma la mthong ba'i phyir the tshom yin na /
analyzed: / ci ste du ma la mthong ba'i phyir the tshom yin na /
translated: But if it is doubt because it is seen in many things,

original: de lta na 'o na de la the tshom za ba bzhin du sa las gyur pa nyid dang rdzas nyid la sogs par snang ba la yang the tshom du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na de la the tshom za ba bzhin du sa las gyur pa nyid dang rdzas nyid la sogs par snang ba la yang the tshom du 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case, just as there is doubt about that, there would be doubt about the appearance of earth, substance, and so on,

original: sa las gyur pa nyid la sogs pa la dum la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa las gyur pa nyid la sogs pa la dum la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because earth and so on are seen in many things.

original: nges pa ni mthong ste /
analyzed: nges pa ni mthong ste /
translated: Certainty is seen.

original: gang gi phyir du ma la yang 'jug bzhin pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir du ma la yang 'jug bzhin pa ni /
translated: Because, even when engaged in many,

original: gang med na mi 'gyur ba des rtogs par byed kyi cig shos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang med na mi 'gyur ba des rtogs par byed kyi cig shos ni ma yin no //
translated: that which is not present when something is absent causes its understanding, not the other.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa'i sgo kho nas rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa'i sgo kho nas rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is only through the route of the reverse pervasion that there is inference.

original: 'di kho na ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di kho na ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: This is precisely what is taught by the statement:

original: gang gi phyir ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of what?‚Äù and so on.

original: ldog pa'i sgo kho nas rtogs par byed pa'o zhes pa 'di gzhung gzugs par bya ba'i ched du bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo kho nas rtogs par byed pa'o zhes pa 'di gzhung gzugs par bya ba'i ched du bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
translated: In order to formulate the text that ‚Äúit is only through the route of the reverse pervasion that there is understanding,‚Äù an intermediary verse is stated:

original: shes bya'i sgra ni yod pa dang rdzas dang sa las gyur pa dang shing nyid de /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgra ni yod pa dang rdzas dang sa las gyur pa dang shing nyid de /
translated: The word ‚Äúknowable‚Äù refers to existence, substance, earth, and tree.

original: gzhi rnams la the tshom gyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: gzhi rnams la the tshom gyi rgyu ste /
translated: These bases are the cause of doubt.

original: gang gi phyir de ni de rnams med na yang mthong bas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni de rnams med na yang mthong bas so //
translated: Because that is seen even when they are absent.

original: 'di ltar du phyi ma rnams @276b la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar du phyi ma rnams @276b la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be stated in the same way for the latter ones as well.

original: yod pa'i sgra ni rdzas dang sa las gyur pa dang shing nyid de gsum rnams la'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i sgra ni rdzas dang sa las gyur pa dang shing nyid de gsum rnams la'o //

analyzed: rdzas kyi sgra ni sa las gyur pa dang shing nyid de gnyis dag la'o //

original: sa las gyur ba'i sgra ni shing nyid gcig pu la'o //
analyzed: sa las gyur ba'i sgra ni shing nyid gcig pu la'o //

original: des la gzhan du zhes pa la rgyu mtshan no zhes 'jug go //
analyzed: des la gzhan du zhes pa la rgyu mtshan no zhes 'jug go //

original: gzhan du zhes pa lugs dang mthun pas te /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes pa lugs dang mthun pas te /

original: shing gi sgra ni sa las gyur pa dang / rdzas dang yod pa dang shes bya ste gzhi rnams la nges pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: shing gi sgra ni sa las gyur pa dang / rdzas dang yod pa dang shes bya ste gzhi rnams la nges pa'i rgyu'o //
