original: de ltar ni de ni de rnams la yang mthong zhing de rnams leg  pa la yang ma mthong bas so //
analyzed: de ltar ni de ni de rnams la yang mthong zhing de rnams leg  pa la yang ma mthong bas so //
translated: Because it is seen that it is those and not seen in the absence of those.

original: de bzhin du phyi ma rnams la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi ma rnams la yang brjod par bya ste /

original: sa las gyur pa'i sgra la sogs pa rnams kyang de bzhin du re res dman pas rdzas nyid la sogs pa rnams la nges pa'i rgyur zhes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa las gyur pa'i sgra la sogs pa rnams kyang de bzhin du re res dman pas rdzas nyid la sogs pa rnams la nges pa'i rgyur zhes par bya'o //
translated: The words earth, substance, existent, and object of knowledge are the causes of ascertainment with regard to tree, because it is seen that it is those and not seen in the absence of those.

original: gal te yang mthong bzhin du bsgrub pas rtogs par byed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yang mthong bzhin du bsgrub pas rtogs par byed par 'gyur na /
translated: If, however, one were to understand by the seeing of the object, the seeing of the object as it is, then,

original: rim pa ji lta bas bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gi don la nges pa dang / de ltar lugs las ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rim pa ji lta bas bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gi don la nges pa dang / de ltar lugs las ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: in the reverse order, there would be certainty about the meaning of four, three, two, and one, respectively.

original: shes bya'i sgra la sogs pa rnams yod pa nyid la sogs pa rnams la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgra la sogs pa rnams yod pa nyid la sogs pa rnams la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the existence of the object of knowledge, etc. is seen in the existence, etc. of sound, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de med na yang mthong ba nyid kyi phyir the tshom ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de med na yang mthong ba nyid kyi phyir the tshom ste /
translated: Because of the seeing of the object of knowledge, etc. even in the absence of existence, etc., there is doubt.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa'i sgo kho nas sgo bar byed pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa'i sgo kho nas sgo bar byed pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one is led to certainty only by the method of difference.

original: 'brel pa'i sgo ma rtogs par zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i sgo ma rtogs par zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: When the relation is not understood, etc.

original: 'brel pa ni med na mi 'byung ba'o //üîΩde kho na sgo ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni med na mi 'byung ba'o // de kho na sgo ste /
translated: The relation is the invariable concomitance.

original: rjes su dpog pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: That is the door to reality, the reason for inference.

original: de yongs su spangs nas sgra ni brtags bzhin du rang gi don rtogs pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yongs su spangs nas sgra ni brtags bzhin du rang gi don rtogs pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Having rejected that, sound does not have the power to make one understand its meaning as it is imagined.

original: bzhin gyi sgra ni dpe nyid la'o ;
analyzed: bzhin gyi sgra ni dpe nyid la'o ;
translated: The word ‚Äúas‚Äù is in the sense of an example.

original: / ji ltar don gyi bdag nyid kyi rtags ni med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa'i sgo nas rtogs par byed cing rang gi don ldog pa'i sgo nas rtogs par byed pa de ltar sgra yang ngo zhes rtogs par bya ba'i ched du brtags bzhin zhes pa'i tshig
analyzed: / ji ltar don gyi bdag nyid kyi rtags ni med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa'i sgo nas rtogs par byed cing rang gi don ldog pa'i sgo nas rtogs par byed pa de ltar sgra yang ngo zhes rtogs par bya ba'i ched du brtags bzhin zhes pa'i tshig
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust as it is imagined‚Äù is for the purpose of understanding this.

analyzed: go // de'i chos du ma nyid na zhes pa / shing sha pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas sam /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif it has many properties‚Äù meansüîΩif it has the divisions of being a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree and so on,

analyzed: me tog can dang 'bras bu can nyid la sogs pa'i dbye bas shing la sogs pa'i don ni chos du ma can nyid na yang /
translated: or if it has the divisions of being a flowering tree, a fruit-bearing tree, and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes pa /üîΩgal te rnam pa thams cad kyis me tog can dang 'bras bu can la @277a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes pa / gal te rnam pa thams cad kyis me tog can dang 'bras bu can la @277a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is impossible to understand all its aspects‚Äù means

original: sogs pas rtogs par gyur na /
analyzed: sogs pas rtogs par gyur na /
translated: if it were understood through all its aspects, such as being a flowering tree and being a fruit-bearing tree,

original: de'i tshe ji skad bshad pa'i 'brel pa med par sgrub pa kho nas rtogs par 'gyur na de yang srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji skad bshad pa'i 'brel pa med par sgrub pa kho nas rtogs par 'gyur na de yang srid pa ma yin te /
translated: then at that time it would be understood only through the proof that lacks the relation explained earlier, but that is impossible.

original: me tog can nyid la sogs pa'i bye brag rnams la 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me tog can nyid la sogs pa'i bye brag rnams la 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is error with respect to the particulars, such as the flower itself, etc.

original: ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni sgrub pa yin te /
translated: The establishment is the understanding in accordance with what is seen.

analyzed: de'i phyir sgrub pas rtog pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang don gzhan las ldog pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Therefore, it is not the conceptualization by the establishment, but rather by the exclusion of other objects.

original: khyad par mi brjod pa'i phyir zhes pa /
analyzed: khyad par mi brjod pa'i phyir zhes pa /
translated: Because the particular is not expressed.

original: de rnams phan tshun med na yang yod pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de rnams phan tshun med na yang yod pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Because they exist even when mutually absent, there is error.

original: spyi brjod par bya ba yin nam yin te /
analyzed: spyi brjod par bya ba yin nam yin te /

analyzed: de tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang / de med na yang sgra med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different from that, and because the word does not exist even when that does not exist.

analyzed: gzhan bkag pa ni khyab pa'i phyir //

analyzed: zhes pa khyab pa ni rang gi khyad par mi spong ba'o //
translated: Pervasion is the non-abandonment of one‚Äôs own particular.

analyzed: gzhan bkag pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i spyi'o //
translated: The exclusion of other is the universal as explained above.

original: de khyab pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de khyab pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of that pervasion.

original: rang gi khyad par rnams la khyab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi khyad par rnams la khyab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Because of the pervasion of one‚Äôs own particulars, is the meaning.

analyzed: gzhan bkag pa'i zhes pa kri ta'i sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi byed pa po la drug pa 'di'o //
translated: The sixth case is for the agent in the sense of the characteristic of the formation of the k·πõt suffix, as in ‚Äúthe negation of another.‚Äù

original: de khyad don dang tha dad med //
analyzed: de khyad don dang tha dad med //
translated: It is not different from the particular.

original: ces pa gzhan sel ba'i khyad par brjod pa rnams dang ste /
analyzed: ces pa gzhan sel ba'i khyad par brjod pa rnams dang ste /
translated: The expressions of the exclusion of another are

original: rdzas la sogs pa'i sgra rnams dang yod pa la sogs pa'i sgra gzhi mthun pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa'i sgra rnams dang yod pa la sogs pa'i sgra gzhi mthun pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the common locus of the words substance and so on and the words existent and so on.

original: spyi'i sgra'i ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩspyi'i sgra'i gang bya ba ste /
analyzed: spyi'i sgra'i ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste / spyi'i sgra'i gang bya ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúof‚Äù in the general word is theüîΩobject of the action.

original: rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: It is what is to be understood.

original: de yang ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: And what is that like?

original: don gzhan bsal ba de ni rang gi don ma spangs pas so //
analyzed: don gzhan bsal ba de ni rang gi don ma spangs pas so //
translated: The exclusion of another object is that which does not abandon its own object.

original: 'dis ni khyab par byed pa nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni khyab par byed pa nyid gsungs so //
translated: This states the pervasion.

original: ji ltar rigs mngon par brjod pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs mngon par brjod pa na /
translated: When the expression of a class is made,

original: rigs gzhan rnams yongs su spong pa de ltar don gzhan sel ba mngon par brjod pa na rdzas nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs gzhan rnams yongs su spong pa de ltar don gzhan sel ba mngon par brjod pa na rdzas nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: other classes are excluded. In the same way, when the expression of the exclusion of another object is made, the distinctions of substance and so on are not.

original: tha mi dad pa'i dngos po'i yod pa'i sgra las rdzas ma spangs pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa can ni blo la so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i dngos po'i yod pa'i sgra las rdzas ma spangs pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa can ni blo la so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the word ‚Äúexistent‚Äù is perceived by the mind in the aspect of not abandoning substance, etc., which are not different from the thing.

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don la'o ces ba'i sgra ni de'i phyir gyi don can no //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don la'o ces ba'i sgra ni de'i phyir gyi don can no //
translated: The word ‚Äúhi‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúbecause,‚Äù and the word ‚Äúiti‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äútherefore.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because it is so, therefore

original: tha dad ba'i don can rdzas la sogs pa'i sgra rnams dang yod pa'i sgra gzhi mthun pa nyid 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad ba'i don can rdzas la sogs pa'i sgra rnams dang yod pa'i sgra gzhi mthun pa nyid 'thad pa'o //
translated: it is tenable that the words ‚Äúsubstance,‚Äù etc., which have the meaning of difference, and the word ‚Äúexistent‚Äù have a common locus.

original: ci ltar byas nas she na shes pa gang 'di ni dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i nyams su myong pas byas pa'i @277b bag chags la brten nas /
analyzed: ci ltar byas nas she na shes pa gang 'di ni dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i nyams su myong pas byas pa'i @277b bag chags la brten nas /
translated: How is this? The cognition that is produced by the latent impressions created by the experience of grasping the nature of a thing,

original: phyi rol gyi don gyi yul can ma yin yang de'i yul can bzhin dang / 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i dngos po las rab tu skyes pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa'i don 'dzin pa lta bu'i rnam par rtogs pa skye'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyi yul can ma yin yang de'i yul can bzhin dang / 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i dngos po las rab tu skyes pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa'i don 'dzin pa lta bu'i rnam par rtogs pa skye'o //
translated: although not having an external object as its object, arises as a conception that grasps a non-different object, like one that has that as its object, because it is produced from a thing that is not different in effect.

original: de la gang don gyi rnam par snang ba tha snyad byed pa po rnams kyis phyi rol gyi don nyid du lhag par zhen pa de la gzhi mthun pa nyid du rnam par gzhag gi / rang gi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gang don gyi rnam par snang ba tha snyad byed pa po rnams kyis phyi rol gyi don nyid du lhag par zhen pa de la gzhi mthun pa nyid du rnam par gzhag gi / rang gi mtshan nyid la ni ma yin te /
translated: The appearance of the object, which is the basis of the designation of the conventional, is conceived by the designating subjects to be an external object.

original: blo la mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo la mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a specific characteristic, because it does not appear to the mind.üîΩThe appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence, which is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence, which is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence.

original: yod pa ma yin ba las log pa'i ngo bor so sor snang bzhin pa de ni tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa'i rjes su song bar so sor snang zhing /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin ba las log pa'i ngo bor so sor snang bzhin pa de ni tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa'i rjes su song bar so sor snang zhing /
translated: The appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence, which is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence.

original: yod pa ma yin pa las ldog pa de kho na ni yang rdzas ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa las kyang log pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa las ldog pa de kho na ni yang rdzas ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa las kyang log pa ste /
translated: The appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence, which is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence, which is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence, which is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence, which is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence, which is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence, which is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence, which is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence.

original: rdzas nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa gnyis pa dang rjes su ldan pa dang tha mi dad par so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: rdzas nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa gnyis pa dang rjes su ldan pa dang tha mi dad par so sor snang ngo //
translated: The appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence, which is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence is the appearance of the object as the opposite of nonexistence, which is the appearance of the object as the opposite of non

original: de'i phyir dngos po gcig yod pa nyid dang rdzas nyid du gsal bzhin pa ni yod pa'i rdzas so zhes yod pa dang rdzas kyi sgra dag gis brjod par bya'o zhes gzhi mthun pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po gcig yod pa nyid dang rdzas nyid du gsal bzhin pa ni yod pa'i rdzas so zhes yod pa dang rdzas kyi sgra dag gis brjod par bya'o zhes gzhi mthun pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the existence and substance of a single entity are to be established as a common locus, saying that the words ‚Äúexistence‚Äù and ‚Äúsubstance‚Äù refer to existent substance.

original: de ltar ni rang gi don la mi 'khrul lo zhes pa /
analyzed: de ltar ni rang gi don la mi 'khrul lo zhes pa /
translated: Thus, there is no error in the meaning of the words.

original: tshogs pa'i don ni khyad par du byas pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i don ni khyad par du byas pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the compound is specified.

original: gal te de rjod par byed bar tshig 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de rjod par byed bar tshig 'gyur na /
translated: If the word were to express that,

original: de'i tshe de med na yang tshig 'jug pa'i phyir de rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de med na yang tshig 'jug pa'i phyir de rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then even when that does not exist, the word would be used, and therefore it would not be understood.

original: gang gi phyir tshogs pa ni sgra gzhan kho na ste de'i rjod byed yin pa de'i phyir 'khrul pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshogs pa ni sgra gzhan kho na ste de'i rjod byed yin pa de'i phyir 'khrul pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the compound is a different word, it is the expression of that. Therefore there is no error.

original: phyi ma'i yang zhes pa /üîΩrang dbang med phyir de ldan min //
analyzed: phyi ma'i yang zhes pa / rang dbang med phyir de ldan min //
translated: The latter ‚Äúalso‚Äù refers to

original: zhes pa 'di'i'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di'i'o //
translated: the line ‚Äúbecause it is not independent, it does not possess it.‚Äù

original: dngos su 'jug phyir zhes pa de dang ldan pa'i phyogs bzhin du yon tan gyi ngo bo phan btags pa'i dngos po sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin pas te /
analyzed: dngos su 'jug phyir zhes pa de dang ldan pa'i phyogs bzhin du yon tan gyi ngo bo phan btags pa'i dngos po sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin pas te /
translated: Because it actually engages, like the side that possesses it, the entity that is the nature of a quality is not the referent of a word.

original: der ni yon tan gzhan gyis phan 'dogs pa 'gal ba'i phyir dor zhing /
analyzed: der ni yon tan gzhan gyis phan 'dogs pa 'gal ba'i phyir dor zhing /
translated: In that case, since it is contradictory for another quality to benefit it, it is rejected.

original: 'dir ni yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan gzhan lam ltos par yod pa ma yin pa bsal ba'i dngos po la sgra 'jug go //
analyzed: 'dir ni yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan gzhan lam ltos par yod pa ma yin pa bsal ba'i dngos po la sgra 'jug go //
translated: Here, a word applies to an entity that is excluded from being something that does not exist, such as being existent, and so on, which are not other qualities.

original: de ston te don gzhan nye bar blangs nas zhes ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ston te don gzhan nye bar blangs nas zhes ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is taught in the line ‚ÄúHaving taken up another object,‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i phyir gzhan dbang nyid yin pas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan dbang nyid yin pas zhes pa ste /
translated: Therefore the line ‚ÄúBecause it is dependent on another‚Äù is stated.

original: gang nye bar blangs nas rdzas la sgra 'jug pa gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba rigs la sogs pa ltar don gzhan cung zad cig @278a * //
analyzed: gang nye bar blangs nas rdzas la sgra 'jug pa gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba rigs la sogs pa ltar don gzhan cung zad cig @278a * //
translated: That which is taken up, the referent of a word for a substance, is not another object, such as a class, called an ‚Äúexclusion of other,‚Äù like a class and so on.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not something else.

original: de'i phyir bar chod ba med pa'i phyir ci zhig las gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir bar chod ba med pa'i phyir ci zhig las gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin /
translated: Therefore, because there is no obstruction, how could it be dependent on another?

original: de kho na ni dngos po yod pa ma yin pa las log pa dngos su brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de kho na ni dngos po yod pa ma yin pa las log pa dngos su brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: That reality is the opposite of the non-existence of things, and is to be expressed directly.

original: de'i phyir de'i khyad par gang yin ba de la tha mi dad pa'i phyir spong bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i khyad par gang yin ba de la tha mi dad pa'i phyir spong bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not different from that, it is not to be rejected.

original: de nyid kyi phyir btags pa'i nyes pa yang med de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir btags pa'i nyes pa yang med de /
translated: For that very reason, there is also no fault of imputation,

original: gzhan du na gtso bor 'jug pa'i sgra ni rdzas la sogs pa rnams la gdags par bya ba ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na gtso bor 'jug pa'i sgra ni rdzas la sogs pa rnams la gdags par bya ba ma yin pas so //
translated: because otherwise the term ‚Äúprimary‚Äù would not be imputed to substances, etc.

original: 'ang ma yin zhes ba la sogs pa khyad bar ni mtha' yas pa thug pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'ang ma yin zhes ba la sogs pa khyad bar ni mtha' yas pa thug pa med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù and so on refer to the endless and infinite distinctions.

original: de'i phyir ma brjod pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma brjod pa'i skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of not expressing them.

original: de ldan khyad par kho nar brjod //
analyzed: de ldan khyad par kho nar brjod //
translated: That which possesses it is said to be a distinction.

original: de yang sngar ni bsal ba yin //
analyzed: de yang sngar ni bsal ba yin //
translated: That has already been refuted earlier.

original: zhes pa 'dis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir spyi ma yin pa'i skyon yang med de /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir spyi ma yin pa'i skyon yang med de /
translated: There is also no fault of non-universality, because it is not a pervader.

original: gang bshad pa /
analyzed: gang bshad pa /
translated: As it was explained:

original: de ldan don ni bum sogs pa'ang //
analyzed: de ldan don ni bum sogs pa'ang //
translated: That which possesses it is the object, such as a pot,

original: zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: and so on.

original: ci'i phyir med ce na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir med ce na gsungs pa /
translated: Why is it not so? It is said:

original: don gzhan sel ba tsam ni tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: don gzhan sel ba tsam ni tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: Because the mere exclusion of other objects is not different.

original: 'dis ni tha dad med phyir zhes pa 'di bkral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni tha dad med phyir zhes pa 'di bkral ba'o //
translated: This explains the phrase ‚Äúbecause they are not different.‚Äù

original: tha dad yod na ni mtha' yas pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tha dad yod na ni mtha' yas pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur zhing /
translated: If they were different, there would be the fault of infinite regress,

original: spyi med pa'i skyon du yang ngo //
analyzed: spyi med pa'i skyon du yang ngo //
translated: and there would be the fault of the nonexistence of universals.

original: gzhan ni gzhan la mi 'jug pa las don gzhan sel ba tsam ni tha mi dad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan la mi 'jug pa las don gzhan sel ba tsam ni tha mi dad pa ste /
translated: The other is not engaged in the other. The mere exclusion of other objects is not different.

original: de la ci las skyon 'di'i skabs yin /
analyzed: de la ci las skyon 'di'i skabs yin /
translated: What is the fault in that?

original: 'o na gang shes pa'i spyi'i rnam pa ni spyir rnam par gzhag cing /
analyzed: 'o na gang shes pa'i spyi'i rnam pa ni spyir rnam par gzhag cing /
translated: Well then, the aspect of the cognition of a universal is posited as a universal.

original: de yang shes pa las tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de yang shes pa las tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: And because it is not different from cognition,

original: gzhan la mi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la mi 'jug pa ste /
translated: it is not engaged in the other.

original: ci ltar spyi yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar spyi yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is it a universal? It is said:

original: rdzas ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdzas ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because it is not a substance, and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa yang spyi'i ngo bor yongs su ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir spyi rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa yang spyi'i ngo bor yongs su ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir spyi rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: And because the aspect of consciousness is not established as a universal entity, a universal does not exist substantially.

original: 'di mi 'dod pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di mi 'dod pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: This is not at all unacceptable.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di kho na don rnams la gcig gi bdag nyid du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di kho na don rnams la gcig gi bdag nyid du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: This very false conception is the apprehension of objects as having the nature of oneness.

original: dngos por na spyi zhes bya ba med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dngos por na spyi zhes bya ba med pa kho na'o //
translated: In reality, there is no such thing as a universal.

original: skye bo 'khrul pa'i bsam pa'i dbang las spyi ru rnam par gzhag pa 'di bya ba 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: skye bo 'khrul pa'i bsam pa'i dbang las spyi ru rnam par gzhag pa 'di bya ba 'ba' zhig go //
translated: This universal is posited only due to the power of the confused thought of beings.

original: tha snyad byed pa po 'khrul ba rnams ni rang gi shes pa'i snang ba'i phyir bye brag kho na phyi rol gyi gsal ba'i khyad bar la rjes su song ba lta bur spyir sems @278b par byed do zhes byas nas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad byed pa po 'khrul ba rnams ni rang gi shes pa'i snang ba'i phyir bye brag kho na phyi rol gyi gsal ba'i khyad bar la rjes su song ba lta bur spyir sems @278b par byed do zhes byas nas so zhes pa'o //
translated: Those who use conventions, due to the appearance in their own consciousness, think of only the particulars as if they pervaded external things.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes pa /
translated: Therefore,

original: dngos su 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos su 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it engages directly,

original: de la ni yod pa nyid kyi phyir khyad par byed kyi ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo'i bar du chod par byed do //
analyzed: de la ni yod pa nyid kyi phyir khyad par byed kyi ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo'i bar du chod par byed do //
translated: In that case, it is a qualifier because of its existence, and it is an interpolator of the intrinsic reality of the entity because it expresses the intrinsic reality.

original: de dang 'brel ba can gyi bum pa nyid la sogs ba rnams ni yod ba nyid dang 'brel pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba can gyi bum pa nyid la sogs ba rnams ni yod ba nyid dang 'brel pa can ma yin te /
translated: But the potness, etc., which are related to that are not related to existence,

original: rigs la rigs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs la rigs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the universal does not have a universal.

original: de'i phyir de'i sgo nas don du ma 'dod pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i sgo nas don du ma 'dod pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a cause of the desire for the many meanings through that.

original: 'di la ni dngos su yod pa ma yin pa 'gog pas rang gi don la sgra 'jug cing /
analyzed: 'di la ni dngos su yod pa ma yin pa 'gog pas rang gi don la sgra 'jug cing /
translated: Here, the word is applied to its own meaning by the negation of the non-existent.

original: de'i phyir de'i khyad par 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid du 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i khyad par 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid du 'thad de /
translated: Therefore, it is tenable as a cause of the desire for its distinction,

original: spyi gzhan ldan pa med par yang ngo //üîΩdngos su don gzhan bkag pa'i phyir zhes pa /üîΩdon gzhan 'gegs pa'i thabs su gyur pa rang gi don rjod par byed pa ni de skad du bshad de /
analyzed: spyi gzhan ldan pa med par yang ngo // dngos su don gzhan bkag pa'i phyir zhes pa / don gzhan 'gegs pa'i thabs su gyur pa rang gi don rjod par byed pa ni de skad du bshad de /
translated: because the other-possessor of the universal does not exist.üîΩBecause it directly negates the other object.üîΩThe means of negating the other object is said to be the expression of its own meaning.

original: rang gi don dngos su rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi don dngos su rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it directly expresses its own meaning.

original: 'dis ni de nyid kyi phyir zhes pa 'di'i don bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni de nyid kyi phyir zhes pa 'di'i don bstan to //
translated: This shows the meaning of ‚Äúbecause of that itself.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang dngos por yod pa'i rigs gzhan dang ldan pa dgag pa brjod par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos por yod pa'i rigs gzhan dang ldan pa dgag pa brjod par 'dod kyi /
translated: Here, too, the possession of another type that exists as a thing is denied.

original: brtags pa'i rigs gzhan dang ldan pa yang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa'i rigs gzhan dang ldan pa yang ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the possession of another type that is imagined.

original: de ltar ni gang yod pa'o zhes brjod pa de kho na de dang de las log pa rnam pa gzhan du so sor snang ba ni brtags pa'i spyi gzhan dang ldan par de lta de ltar rnam par 'byed pas so //
analyzed: de ltar ni gang yod pa'o zhes brjod pa de kho na de dang de las log pa rnam pa gzhan du so sor snang ba ni brtags pa'i spyi gzhan dang ldan par de lta de ltar rnam par 'byed pas so //
translated: In this way, that which is called ‚Äúexistent‚Äù is that which appears individually in a different way, as the opposite of this and that, through the differentiation of the possession of another type that is imagined.

original: 'di kho na la rnam par gnas so zhes pa ni rigs shing ldan no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di kho na la rnam par gnas so zhes pa ni rigs shing ldan no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is only this that remains‚Äù means that it is reasonable to possess it.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir gcig nyid de /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir gcig nyid de /
translated: Because it is not different, it is one.

original: don gzhan sle ba ni blo la tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid du so sor snang bas na /
analyzed: don gzhan sle ba ni blo la tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid du so sor snang bas na /
translated: The approach of another object is the appearance individually as an undifferentiated entity in the mind.

original: tha snyad kyi rjes su 'gro ba rnams kyis gcig nyid du lhag par zhe na pa'o zhes pas de gcig nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi rjes su 'gro ba rnams kyis gcig nyid du lhag par zhe na pa'o zhes pas de gcig nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Those who follow convention are attached to it as one. Thus, it is established as one.

original: rten mi 'chad pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid de /
analyzed: rten mi 'chad pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid de /
translated: It is permanent because its basis is uninterrupted.

original: rten ni de'i don gyi bya ba byed pa nyid kyis de mi byed pa rnams las log pa'i khyad par rnams yin zhing de rnams ni rang nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas sgra'i don gyi rgyu mtshan du 'gyur te sngar ji skad bshad ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rten ni de'i don gyi bya ba byed pa nyid kyis de mi byed pa rnams las log pa'i khyad par rnams yin zhing de rnams ni rang nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas sgra'i don gyi rgyu mtshan du 'gyur te sngar ji skad bshad ba bzhin no //
translated: The basis is the particularities that are the opposite of those that do not perform the function of the object of that. Those are the reasons for the object of the word, which are experienced by oneself, as previously explained.

original: de rnams kyang chad pa med pa ste mtha' yas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang chad pa med pa ste mtha' yas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Those are also uninterrupted, because they are infinite.

original: de'i phyir de rnams ji snyed pa de snyed de'o zhes pas rtag pa nyid du brtag pa yang 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams ji snyed pa de snyed de'o zhes pas rtag pa nyid du brtag pa yang 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is tenable to consider them as permanent, as many as there are.

original: don mtha' dag rtogs pa'i phyir ni re re la yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: don mtha' dag rtogs pa'i phyir ni re re la yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: Because of understanding all objects, each is complete.

original: don gzhan sel ba ni pa la sha la sogs pa la so sor blo yongs su 'jug @279a * //
analyzed: don gzhan sel ba ni pa la sha la sogs pa la so sor blo yongs su 'jug @279a * //
translated: The exclusion of other objects is the complete engagement of the mind in individual things such as a pot.

original: pa na / tha snyad kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rtogs pa po rnams kyis thams cad kyi bdag nyid du rtogs so zhes pas de'i rtogs pa'i ngor rnam par gzhag par bya bzhin pa mtha' dag pa'i don yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: pa na / tha snyad kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rtogs pa po rnams kyis thams cad kyi bdag nyid du rtogs so zhes pas de'i rtogs pa'i ngor rnam par gzhag par bya bzhin pa mtha' dag pa'i don yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gal lo //
translated: The one who understands in accordance with convention understands everything as having the nature of that. Thus, it is not contradictory that the entire meaning of what is being posited is completely fulfilled from the perspective of that understanding.

original: yon tan 'phel ba'i phyir zhes pa rigs kyi chos rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di kho na la rigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan 'phel ba'i phyir zhes pa rigs kyi chos rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di kho na la rigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the increase of qualities, the qualities of the family are posited as just that, because they are the very family.

original: rigs dngos por yod pa'i phyogs la ni ji ltar de mi 'thad pa de ltar spyi brtag pa'i skabs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs dngos por yod pa'i phyogs la ni ji ltar de mi 'thad pa de ltar spyi brtag pa'i skabs su rig par bya'o //
translated: In the position that the family exists as a thing, how that is untenable should be understood in the context of the examination of universals.

original: gzhan sel nges pa spyi las yin //
analyzed: gzhan sel nges pa spyi las yin //
translated: Exclusion of other is ascertained from the universal.

original: zhes pa rgyu 'ga' zhig las kyang ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa rgyu 'ga' zhig las kyang ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that it is not from any cause.

original: sngon po la sogs pa rnams phan tshun gyi ngo bo yang dag par rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rnams phan tshun gyi ngo bo yang dag par rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because blue and so on do not truly share the nature of each other,

original: ro la sogs pa bzhin du de rnams kyang tha dad do /
analyzed: ro la sogs pa bzhin du de rnams kyang tha dad do /
translated: they are also different, like taste and so on.

original: de las tha dad par mtshungs pa la gzugs kyi sgras ro la sogs pa rnams sel gyi kha dog gang yang rung ba brjod pa na kha dog lhag ma rnams ni ma yin zhes pa 'di la nges pa'i rgyu ci yang med do //
analyzed: de las tha dad par mtshungs pa la gzugs kyi sgras ro la sogs pa rnams sel gyi kha dog gang yang rung ba brjod pa na kha dog lhag ma rnams ni ma yin zhes pa 'di la nges pa'i rgyu ci yang med do //
translated: But there is no reason at all to say that the word form excludes taste, etc., but does not exclude any of the remaining colors when it refers to any color.

original: 'dis ni khas blangs dang 'gal ba smras so //
analyzed: 'dis ni khas blangs dang 'gal ba smras so //
translated: This is a contradiction of your own beliefs.

original: 'o na khyod la yang rtsod pa mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na khyod la yang rtsod pa mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Well, is not your argument similar to ours?

original: ci'i phyir gzugs kyi sgra sngon po la sogs pa rnams thams cad la 'jug cing /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs kyi sgra sngon po la sogs pa rnams thams cad la 'jug cing /
translated: Why does the word form apply to all such things as blue,

original: yang kha dog gang yang rung ba brjod pa na rol sogs pa rnams la /
analyzed: yang kha dog gang yang rung ba brjod pa na rol sogs pa rnams la /
translated: and when it refers to any color,

original: gzhan du lhag rnams la mi 'jug / ces pa de'i phyir smras pa gang gi ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du lhag rnams la mi 'jug / ces pa de'i phyir smras pa gang gi ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: why does it not apply to the others, such as taste?

original: gang gi rdzas su yod pa'i spyi gzugs nyid tha mi dad pa de la ni /
analyzed: gang gi rdzas su yod pa'i spyi gzugs nyid tha mi dad pa de la ni /
translated: To answer that, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is a universal that is different from the substances,

original: des byas pa'i nges pa ste /
analyzed: des byas pa'i nges pa ste /
translated: then it is not produced by them,üîΩand it is not reasonable that it be the cause of their distinctions.

original: gang la de yod pa de kho na la gzugs kyi sgra 'jug cing de yang sngon po la sogs pa rnams kho na la yod kyi ro la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la de yod pa de kho na la gzugs kyi sgra 'jug cing de yang sngon po la sogs pa rnams kho na la yod kyi ro la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúform‚Äù is used only for that which has that, and that exists only for blue, etc., but not for taste, etc.

original: de'i phyir rdzas su yod pa'i spyi khas blang bar bya'o zhes pa bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzas su yod pa'i spyi khas blang bar bya'o zhes pa bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that the universal of substantial existence must be accepted.

original: 'jig rten grags pa brtsal mi bya //
analyzed: 'jig rten grags pa brtsal mi bya //
translated: One should not seek to analyze what is known in the world.

original: zhes pa'i dbyings rnams ni du ma'i don can nyid kyi phyir mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i dbyings rnams ni du ma'i don can nyid kyi phyir mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the words is that one should not be attached to the universals, because they have the meaning of multiplicity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gsungs pas so zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pas so zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said, etc.

original: skye bo'i nges pa'i tshig ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad do //
analyzed: skye bo'i nges pa'i tshig ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad do //
translated: The etymology of ‚Äúworld‚Äù is ‚Äúthat which is agreed upon by the people.‚Äù

original: tshogs pa'i sgra rnams ni yod pa nyid la sogs pa dngos por gyur pa'i spyi rab tu 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan rgyu ra byas nas de dang ldan pa la 'jug mod /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i sgra rnams ni yod pa nyid la sogs pa dngos por gyur pa'i spyi rab tu 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan rgyu ra byas nas de dang ldan pa la 'jug mod /
translated: The words for collections are used, having made the reason for the application of the universals such as existence the cause, to refer to that which possesses them.

original: @279b yod pa nyid la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa'i spyi la rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir yongs su bshad pa 'dod rgyal ba'o zhes pas 'di ltar mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
analyzed: @279b yod pa nyid la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa'i spyi la rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir yongs su bshad pa 'dod rgyal ba'o zhes pas 'di ltar mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
translated: Since there is no other reason for the existence of universals such as existence, this explanation is arbitrary.

original: dngos por gyur pa'i spyi mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa'i spyi mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Do not cling to this, because it is illogical for a universal to be a real entity.üîΩAlso, do not apply the name ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù to a collection of particulars, because that is illogical.üîΩDo not apply the name ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù to a collection of particulars, because that is illogical.üîΩDo not apply the name ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù to a collection of particulars, because that is illogical.

original: ming yang zhes pa la sogs pa tha snyad kyang rgyug par mi bya zhing mi 'da' bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //üîΩde'i phyir zhes pa gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar gsungs shing mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ming yang zhes pa la sogs pa tha snyad kyang rgyug par mi bya zhing mi 'da' bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to // de'i phyir zhes pa gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar gsungs shing mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: Do not apply the name ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù to a collection of particulars, because that is illogical.

original: de'i dngos po ni yang dag pa'i don can nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni yang dag pa'i don can nyid do //
translated: Do not apply the name ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù to a collection of particulars, because that is illogical.üîΩDo not apply the name ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù

original: des brtsal bar mi bya zhing mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
analyzed: des brtsal bar mi bya zhing mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not search for it, nor should one settle down on it.

original: 'di ltar gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third characteristic of the real.üîΩOne should understand it just as the world does.

original: 'jig rten bzhin kho na rjes su rtogs par bya'o zhes pa ji ltar 'jig rten pa mngon par ma zhen par rjes su rtogs par byed pa de ltar kho bo cag gis kyang rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten bzhin kho na rjes su rtogs par bya'o zhes pa ji ltar 'jig rten pa mngon par ma zhen par rjes su rtogs par byed pa de ltar kho bo cag gis kyang rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Just as the world understands without settling down, so we also should understand.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi dngos por yod pa'i spyi med par 'jig rten na yang gzugs kyi sgra ro la sogs pa rnams la bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa rnams la 'grub pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi dngos por yod pa'i spyi med par 'jig rten na yang gzugs kyi sgra ro la sogs pa rnams la bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa rnams la 'grub pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: This is true, but in the world, without a universal that exists as a real entity, it is not established that the word blue refers to blue, as it does to form, sound, taste, etc.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: grub po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: grub po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is established, etc.

original: dngos por yod pa'i spyi med kyang //
analyzed: dngos por yod pa'i spyi med kyang //
translated: Even without a universal that exists as a real entity,

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa'i spyi kho na las gzugs kyi sgra 'jig rten na sngon po la sogs pa rnams kho na la grub kyi rol sogs pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa'i spyi kho na las gzugs kyi sgra 'jig rten na sngon po la sogs pa rnams kho na la grub kyi rol sogs pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúform‚Äù is established in the world only for blue and so on, not for taste and so on, because the universal that exists conventionally is only that.

original: der ni sngon po la sogs pa kho na la 'jug gi ro la sogs pa rnams la ma yin no //
analyzed: der ni sngon po la sogs pa kho na la 'jug gi ro la sogs pa rnams la ma yin no //
translated: There, the word ‚Äúform‚Äù is used only for blue and so on, not for taste and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyis rang nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas rnam pa de lta bu'i spyi'i rnam pa rnam par rtog pa'i blo la gtod par byed de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rang nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas rnam pa de lta bu'i spyi'i rnam pa rnam par rtog pa'i blo la gtod par byed de /
translated: It is the universal that is the cause of the engagement of the word ‚Äúform‚Äù in that way, because it causes the conceptual cognition to apprehend the aspect of the universal in that way through the door of the experience of its nature.

original: gang gis 'jig rten de rnams kho na la gzugs kyi tha snyad byed cing cig shos la ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'jig rten de rnams kho na la gzugs kyi tha snyad byed cing cig shos la ma yin pa'o //
translated: By that, the word ‚Äúform‚Äù is used for only those, not for the others.

original: de la 'di 'gyur mod gal te de 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan kun rdzob tu yod pa'i spyi sngon po la sogs pa kho na la 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de la 'di 'gyur mod gal te de 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan kun rdzob tu yod pa'i spyi sngon po la sogs pa kho na la 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: This is the case, but if the reason for the engagement of the word ‚Äúform‚Äù were only the universal that exists conventionally, such as blue,

original: gzugs kyi sgra sngon po la sogs pa kho na la 'grub par 'gyur mod de yang med de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sgra sngon po la sogs pa kho na la 'grub par 'gyur mod de yang med de /
translated: then the word ‚Äúform‚Äù would be established for only blue and so on. But that does not exist.

original: shin tu tha dad par mtshungs pa la sngon po la sogs pa kho na la de 'jug gi rol sogs pa la ma yin no zhes pa 'di ci zhig @280a * //
analyzed: shin tu tha dad par mtshungs pa la sngon po la sogs pa kho na la de 'jug gi rol sogs pa la ma yin no zhes pa 'di ci zhig @280a * //
translated: The meaning is that this application is the same for you.

analyzed: las yin / ro la sogs ba la mi 'jug pa bzhin du ser po la sogs pa la yang mi 'jug go zhe na gsungs pa /

analyzed: zhes pa mig gzung nyid la ste /
translated: The meaning is that

analyzed: nges pa'i rgyur 'dod pa la bya ba'i rgyu mtshan can du gzugs kyi sgra 'gyur gyi /

analyzed: mig gis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe eye sees‚Äù teaches the reason for the action as the fault of that assertion.

analyzed: 'o na de ltar na gzugs nyid kyi 'phrod pa 'du ba byas par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /

original: sgra ni rigs kyi rgyu mtshan can kho na ste /
analyzed: sgra ni rigs kyi rgyu mtshan can kho na ste /

analyzed: gzugs nyid tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan du rtog pa la /

analyzed: mig gis gzung bya nyid ni gzugs nyid dang 'brel ba'i'o zhes pa'o //

analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du pa ni rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir gzugs nyid 'phrod pa 'du bar mi smra'i //

analyzed: 'on kyang 'phrod pa 'dus pa nyid mngon par gsal ba'o zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /

original: gzugs nyid mngon par gsal ba zhes pa @280b ste ;
analyzed: gzugs nyid mngon par gsal ba zhes pa @280b ste ;

original: bya bas byas par thob bo zhes sprel bar bya'o //
analyzed: bya bas byas par thob bo zhes sprel bar bya'o //

original: 'dis kyang khas blangs pas gnod pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dis kyang khas blangs pas gnod pa gsungs te /

analyzed: gzugs nyid la sogs pa rnams rang gi rten gyis gsal bar bya ba nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro // mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid kyang zhes pa rang bzhin gyi dbye ba yod na ci'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa rnams kho na la mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid 'jug gi rol sogs pa rnams la yang ni ma yin no zhes 'di la yang
translated: Because you accept that form and so on are manifested by their own supports.üîΩIf you say that form and so on are apprehended by the eye,

original: nges pa'i rgyu brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu brjod par bya'o //
translated: then you must state the reason why the quality of being apprehended by the eye applies only to blue and so on but not to the eye and so forth.

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar shin tu ring bar yang phyin nas rang bzhin nyid la brten par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar shin tu ring bar yang phyin nas rang bzhin nyid la brten par bya ste /

original: gang gis de kho na la mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur gyi ro la sogs pa rnams la ni ma yin pa 'di 'dra ba ni sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis de kho na la mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur gyi ro la sogs pa rnams la ni ma yin pa 'di 'dra ba ni sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: How could it be that it is the object to be apprehended by the eye and not the taste, etc.? Such is not the nature of blue, etc.

analyzed: khyod kyis ji lta ba de ltar kho bos kyang ngo zhes pas rtsod pa'i lan mtshungs pa'o //
translated: You say, ‚ÄúIt is just as you say, I also say that.‚Äù This is a similar response to the dispute.üîΩIt follows that substance, etc.

original: rdzas sogs rnams la'ang thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rdzas sogs rnams la'ang thal bar 'gyur //
translated: are also form.

original: zhes pa / gal te gang du mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa der gzugs nyid yin na /
analyzed: zhes pa / gal te gang du mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa der gzugs nyid yin na /
translated: If that which is to be apprehended by the eye is form,

original: rdzas la sogs pa rnams la yang gzugs nyid du 'gyur ta /
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa rnams la yang gzugs nyid du 'gyur ta /
translated: then substance, etc. would also be form.

original: de rnams mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: de rnams mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: This is because they are to be apprehended by the eye.

original: rdzas nyid dang grangs dang tshad rnams dang so so pa nyid dang ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dag dang / gzhan nyid dang gzhan min pa nyid dag dang las ni gzugs can la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir mig gis gzung bar bya ba rnams so zhes pa'i tshigs las so //
analyzed: rdzas nyid dang grangs dang tshad rnams dang so so pa nyid dang ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dag dang / gzhan nyid dang gzhan min pa nyid dag dang las ni gzugs can la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir mig gis gzung bar bya ba rnams so zhes pa'i tshigs las so //
translated: Substance, number, dimension, separateness, conjunction, action, space, time, and the self are apprehended by the eye because they are visible.

translated: Blue, yellow, and so on would not be different because they are not different in being objects of the eye.üîΩIf you assert that blue and so on are not different in being form because they are objects of the eye, then blue, yellow, and so on would not be different because they are not different in being objects of the eye.üîΩIf you assert that blue and so on are not different in being form because they are objects of the eye, then blue, yellow, and so on would not be different because they are not different in being objects of the eye.

original: de la mig gis gzung bar bya pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de la mig gis gzung bar bya pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: If you assert that blue and so on are not different in being form because they are objects of the eye, then blue, yellow, and so on would not be different because they are not different in being objects of the eye.

original: de bye brag med pa yod na yang /
analyzed: de bye brag med pa yod na yang /
translated: Even if it exists without distinction,

original: sngon po nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa las bye brag tu 'gyur na ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa las bye brag tu 'gyur na ma yin te /

original: de kho na mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not possess reality.

original: sngon po la sogs pa rnams la ni gang las sngon po nyid la sogs pa 'phrod pa 'du ba nges par 'gyur ba rgyu so sor nges pa cung zad kyang @281a * //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rnams la ni gang las sngon po nyid la sogs pa 'phrod pa 'du ba nges par 'gyur ba rgyu so sor nges pa cung zad kyang @281a * //
translated: In the case of blue, etc., there is not the slightest cause that is individually determined, from which there would be a definite encounter of the real entity that is blue, etc.

original: yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the cause is individually determined.

original: nus pa tha dad pa'i rgyu yod do zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa tha dad pa'i rgyu yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is a cause that has a different potency,

original: de la yang gang las de 'ga' zhig kho na la 'jug gi gzhan thams cad la ma yin pa'i rgyu ci zhig yod ces pas 'di ni lan la yin no //
analyzed: de la yang gang las de 'ga' zhig kho na la 'jug gi gzhan thams cad la ma yin pa'i rgyu ci zhig yod ces pas 'di ni lan la yin no //

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar zhes pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar zhes pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúwithout a doubt.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir mig gis gzung bya nyid ni gzugs nyid dang ldan pa'i ngor gtan tshigs nyid du rigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mig gis gzung bya nyid med par nges par sbyor ba las sngon po la sogs pa rnams kho na la gzugs kyi sgra 'jig
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig gis gzung bya nyid ni gzugs nyid dang ldan pa'i ngor gtan tshigs nyid du rigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mig gis gzung bya nyid med par nges par sbyor ba las sngon po la sogs pa rnams kho na la gzugs kyi sgra 'jig
translated: Because it is not logical for the object of apprehension of the eye itself to be a reason for the form itself, therefore, the term ‚Äúform‚Äù is applied to only blue, etc.,

original: rten na grags pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya'i rol sogs pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten na grags pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya'i rol sogs pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: because of the absence of the object of apprehension of the eye, following the usage known in the world, and not to the taste, etc.

original: grags pa'i rgyu mtshan yang kun rdzob tu yod pa'i spyi kho na ste /
analyzed: grags pa'i rgyu mtshan yang kun rdzob tu yod pa'i spyi kho na ste /
translated: The reason for the usage is only the universal that exists conventionally,

original: rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin no zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin no zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: and not the substantial existent. This is the intended meaning.

original: slar yang don gzhan las ldog pa'i sogs sgra rang gi don rtogs par byed do zhes pa 'di bstan par bya ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang don gzhan las ldog pa'i sogs sgra rang gi don rtogs par byed do zhes pa 'di bstan par bya ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: Again, in order to demonstrate that the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù in ‚Äúfrom the exclusion of other objects, etc.‚Äù causes one to understand its own meaning, he says,

original: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf, on the other hand, etc.‚Äù

original: rjes 'gro nyid las 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: rjes 'gro nyid las 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: it is established from the positive concomitance.

original: zhes pa don gzhan las ldog pa la mi ltos pa nyid na rjes 'gro 'ba' zhig pa kho na las khyad par gyi brjod par bya ba nges par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: zhes pa don gzhan las ldog pa la mi ltos pa nyid na rjes 'gro 'ba' zhig pa kho na las khyad par gyi brjod par bya ba nges par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were not dependent on the reversal of the meaning of another, then the object of expression would be ascertained only from the positive alone.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa lhan cig pa dag las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa lhan cig pa dag las ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not from the co-occurrence of the positive and negative.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod /
translated: That may be so.üîΩBut what is the harm in that?

original: 'gyur du chug kyang de la gnod pa med pa ci yin zhe na gsungs pa 'dod pa yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur du chug kyang de la gnod pa med pa ci yin zhe na gsungs pa 'dod pa yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúEven though desired,‚Äù and so on.

original: byed pa po'i mchog tu thob par 'dod pa ni zhes pa /
analyzed: byed pa po'i mchog tu thob par 'dod pa ni zhes pa /
translated: ‚ÄúOne who desires to attain the status of the supreme agent‚Äù

original: byed pa po kho na'i ste /
analyzed: byed pa po kho na'i ste /
translated: is only the agent.

original: byed pa po min pa'i ni ma yin zhing byed pa po'i sgra ni byed pa po min pa rnam par gcod par byed cing mchog tu 'dod pa rang gi don dang 'brel par byed do //
analyzed: byed pa po min pa'i ni ma yin zhing byed pa po'i sgra ni byed pa po min pa rnam par gcod par byed cing mchog tu 'dod pa rang gi don dang 'brel par byed do //
translated: The word ‚Äúagent‚Äù excludes the non-agent, and the supreme is connected with one‚Äôs own purpose.

original: de bzhin du shin tu thob par 'dod pa de kho na ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du shin tu thob par 'dod pa de kho na ste /
translated: In the same way, ‚Äúone who desires to attain that alone‚ÄùüîΩis the agent.

original: shin tu thob par 'dod pa min pa ni ma yin shin tu thob par 'dod pa'i sgra yang mchog tu thob pa 'dod min pa rnam par bsal nas byed pa po'i sgra don rang gi don dang sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: shin tu thob par 'dod pa min pa ni ma yin shin tu thob par 'dod pa'i sgra yang mchog tu thob pa 'dod min pa rnam par bsal nas byed pa po'i sgra don rang gi don dang sbyor bar byed do //
translated: It is not that he does not want to obtain it very much, but the word ‚Äúwant‚Äù is used to exclude the extreme of wanting to obtain it very much, and the word ‚Äúagent‚Äù is applied to its own meaning.

original: de ltar gnyis ka nges par gzungs bas khyad par du byas pa'i don nges pa'i phyir mngon par brjod pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis ka nges par gzungs bas khyad par du byas pa'i don nges pa'i phyir mngon par brjod pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, because the meaning qualified by both is ascertained, verbal expression has a result.

original: gang yang rung ba nges par gzung bas ni ji ltar na /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba nges par gzung bas ni ji ltar na /
translated: When one or the other is ascertained, how is it?

original: sprin rnams yod na char 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sprin rnams yod na char 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúIf there are clouds, it will rain.‚Äù

original: yod pa kho na yin gyi med pa ni ma yin gyi @281b mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa kho na yin gyi med pa ni ma yin gyi @281b mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes pa'o //
translated: It is only existent, not nonexistent, and it will certainly happen.

original: de ltar gang yang rung ba'am /üîΩgnyis ka nges par gzung pas mngon par brjod ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gang yang rung ba'am / gnyis ka nges par gzung pas mngon par brjod ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, when one or the other is ascertained,üîΩbecause verbal expression has a result,

original: ldog pa las kyang khyad par gyi don mngon par brjod par 'dod de /
analyzed: ldog pa las kyang khyad par gyi don mngon par brjod par 'dod de /
translated: the meaning qualified by exclusion is also asserted to be the object of verbal expression.

original: des na don gzhan las ldog pa la mi ltos pa nyid la sgra mi 'thob po zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na don gzhan las ldog pa la mi ltos pa nyid la sgra mi 'thob po zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the word is not obtained in dependence on the mere exclusion of other objects.

original: de ltar ni gal te byed pa po min pa'i yang mchog tu 'dod pa las yin na /
analyzed: de ltar ni gal te byed pa po min pa'i yang mchog tu 'dod pa las yin na /
translated: In this way, if the supreme object of desire is from that which is not the agent,

original: byed pa po'i sgra brjod pa don med par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: byed pa po'i sgra brjod pa don med par 'gyur zhing /
translated: then the expression of the word ‚Äúagent‚Äù would be meaningless.

original: de bzhin du gal te mchog tu 'dod pa ma yin pa yang las yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te mchog tu 'dod pa ma yin pa yang las yin na /
translated: Similarly, if that which is not the supreme object of desire is the object,

original: mchog tu thob par 'dod pa zhes brjod pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir don gzhan las ldog pa'i sgo nas sgras don rtogs par byed do zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mchog tu thob par 'dod pa zhes brjod pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro // de'i phyir don gzhan las ldog pa'i sgo nas sgras don rtogs par byed do zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: then the expression ‚Äúsupreme object of desire‚Äù would be meaningless.üîΩTherefore, one should accept that the word conveys the meaning by way of the exclusion of other objects.

original: 'o na yang zhes pa la sogs ba ni don gzhan med pa tsam sgra'i don du sgro btags nas rtsod par byed do //
analyzed: 'o na yang zhes pa la sogs ba ni don gzhan med pa tsam sgra'i don du sgro btags nas rtsod par byed do //
translated: Now, if one superimposes the mere absence of other objects as the meaning of the word, one argues as follows.

original: sel ba smra ba po la don gzhan las ldog pa tsam las gzhan pa'i brjod par bya ba yod pa ma yin zhing don gzhan las ldog pa yang ldog pa 'ba' zhig pa kho nas bya ba'o zhes pas ldog pa kho na las rjod par byed par 'gyur
analyzed: sel ba smra ba po la don gzhan las ldog pa tsam las gzhan pa'i brjod par bya ba yod pa ma yin zhing don gzhan las ldog pa yang ldog pa 'ba' zhig pa kho nas bya ba'o zhes pas ldog pa kho na las rjod par byed par 'gyur
translated: For the proponent of exclusion, there is no other object of expression than the mere exclusion from other objects, and the exclusion from other objects is done only by the mere exclusion. Thus, it is said that it is expressed by exclusion alone.

original: ro // sgras don gzhan las ldog pa tsam bya ba ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: ro // sgras don gzhan las ldog pa tsam bya ba ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: Sound does not function merely to exclude other objects.

original: 'o na ci zhe na don gzhan las ldog pa'i sgo rnams btags pa pa'i rang gi don rtogs par byed do zhes gsal bar byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na don gzhan las ldog pa'i sgo rnams btags pa pa'i rang gi don rtogs par byed do zhes gsal bar byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: Rather, it is said that it makes known the own-meaning of the imputations that are the doors of exclusion from other objects.

original: 'di 'di ltar 'gyur na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di 'di ltar 'gyur na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is stated by ‚ÄúIt is like this‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: dngos po yi ni gtso bor zhes pa dngos po yod pa nyid kyi spyi zhes bya bas sgra'i rjes su 'gro pa mi 'dod de de mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yi ni gtso bor zhes pa dngos po yod pa nyid kyi spyi zhes bya bas sgra'i rjes su 'gro pa mi 'dod de de mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe principal of entities‚Äù means that the universal of the existence of entities is not accepted as the semantic of a word, because that is not tenable.

original: de mi rung bar dngos po rnams la ma yin zhes pa la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: de mi rung bar dngos po rnams la ma yin zhes pa la sogs pas ston to //
translated: That it is not tenable is shown by ‚ÄúIt is not in entities‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

analyzed: brjod zin to zhes pa rab tu byed pa gzhan du'o // 'dir yang gal te yang spyir 'gyur na zhes pa la sogs pas dang / de bzhin du khyad par rnams rang gi dbang po rnams kyis nye bar dmigs na zhes pa la sogs pas kyang ngo // rigs med par ni zhes pa rigs dang bral ba ste / dngos por yod pa dang bral ba zhes pa'i tha tshig go // don gzhan sel bas khyad par du byas pa'i don la zhes pa brjod par 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu la ste /
translated: It has been said means in another chapter.
